items.name: Date.format([format], [resource])
items.body:
A date/time formatting. If the `format string` starts with `!` the hours will be converted to AM/PM time. Name of days and months can be translated via resources.

```js
Date.format([format], [resource]);
// @format {String} Date/time format.
// @resource {String} A resource name.
// returns String;

d - day e.g. 1
dd - day e.g. 01
ddd - day (named). MO
dddd - day (named). Monday
M - month e.g. 1
MM - month e.g. 01
MMM - month (named). Jan
MMMM - month (named). January
yy - year e.g. 16
yyyy - year e.g. 2016
w - week number e.g. 1
ww - week number e.g. 01
H - hour e.g. 1
HH - hour e.g. 01
m - minute e.g. 1
mm - minute e.g. 01
s - second e.g. 1
ss - second e.g. 01
a - AM/PM
```

```
console.log(new Date().format('dd.MM.yyyy HH:mm:ss'));
console.log(new Date().format()); // returns ISO date without 'Z'

console.log(new Date().format('dd. MMMM yyyy'));
// Output: 12. February 2016

console.log(new Date().format('!HH:mm a'));
// Output: 11:07 AM

// How to translate months and days according to the specific a resource file?
console.log(new Date().format('dddd MMMM yyyy', 'resource_name'));
```

__/resources/resouce_name.resource:__

```
// Months
January       : Január
February      : Február
March         : Marec
...
// Days
Monday        : Pondelok
Thuesday      : Utorok
...
```

items.name: static_accepts
items.body:
Which files are allowed by the framework for handling static files? Values in config files have to be separated with the comma `,` (on one line).

```js
static_accepts;
// returns String Array;
```

__Default:__

```
['.jpg', '.png', '.gif', '.heif', '.heic', '.ico', '.js', '.mjs', '.coffee', '.css', '.txt', '.xml', '.woff', '.woff2', '.otf', '.ttf', '.eot', '.svg', '.zip', '.rar', '.pdf', '.docx', '.xlsx', '.doc', '.xls', '.html', '.htm', '.appcache', '.map', '.ogg', '.mp4', '.mp3', '.webp', '.webm', '.swf', '.package', '.json', '.md', '.ics']
```
__The config file declaration:__

```
static_accepts            : .jpg, .ico, .js
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: url:value
items.body: __IMPORTANT__: The URL address must be relative or absolute. This element will automatically download and import the content.
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: init:path.to.method
items.body: *Optional*. A method according to the value of `init` will be executed after the content will be imported.
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: cache:value
items.body: *Optional*. Enables `localStorage` caching for future usage. It can contain: `1 day` or `10 minutes`.
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: class:value
items.body: *Optional*. Toggles a `class` or `classes` on the current element after the content will be imported.
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: reevaluate:true
items.body: `+v18` *Optional*. Can re-evaluate again scripts and styles. By default are scripts/styles evaluated only one-time, this behaviour can evaluate them again. Default: `false`.
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: replace:true
items.body: *Optional*. Can replace a current element with a new content. Otherwise the content will appended. Default: `false`.
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: target:selector
items.body: *Optional*. Can import the content into the specific `target` and `selector` means jQuery selector.
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: import
items.body:
Performs `IMPORT()`. Expression must be __URL address__ `String` or (`+v16`) `value` must return a valid URL adress.

This command imports each resource only one time.

```html
<ui-bind path="some.path" config="import:https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/d3/5.7.0/d3.min.js"></ui-bind>

<ui-bind path="some.path" config="import:value"></ui-bind>
```

`+v18` adds a support for `<script type="text/html">`:

```html
<ui-bind path="some.path" config="show;import:true">
	<script type="text/html">
		The content will be evaluated when the element will be visible.
	</script>
</ui-bind>
```

`+v18` supports __ENV__:

```html
<script>
    ENV('mycdn', 'https://totaljs.com');
</script>

<ui-bind path="some.path" config="import:[mycdn]/js/app.js"></ui-bind>
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: attr
items.body:
`+v18` command sets a value into the custom attribute:

```html
<ui-bind path="some.path" config="attr data-id"></ui-bind>
<ui-bind path="some.path" config="attr data-id:value"></ui-bind>

<!-- With nested selector: -->
<ui-bind path="some.path" config="attr data-id b:value"></ui-bind>
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
Navigation uses [__jRouting library__](https://github.com/totaljs/jRouting), this library is designed for creating __Single Page Applications__. jComponent navigation uses two aliases to navigation:

- `NAV` or `NAVIGATION` defined in `window` scope
- [Source-code on GitHub](https://github.com/totaljs/jRouting)

items.name: DEF.dateformat
items.body:
A default date format. It's used when `new Date().format(null)` contains `null` value.

```js
DEF.dateformat;
// return String;
// default: undefined
```

__Formatting__:

```html
yy    - short years              e.g. "17"
yyyy  - full years               e.g. "2017"
M     - short months             e.g. "2"
MM    - short months             e.g. "02"
MMM   - called months            e.g. "Sep" (defined in globa variable MONTHS)
MMMM  - called months            e.g. "September" (defined in globa variable MONTHS)
w     - week                     e.g. "3"
ww    - week                     e.g. "03"
D     - short days               e.g. "9"
DD    - short days               e.g. "09"
DDD   - called days              e.g. "MO" (defined in globa variable DAYS)
DDDD  - called days              e.g. "Monday" (defined in globa variable DAYS)
H     - short hours              e.g. "1"
HH    - short hours              e.g. "01"
m     - short minutes            e.g. "1"
mm    - short minutes            e.g. "01"
s     - short seconds            e.g. "4"
ss    - short seconds            e.g. "04"
a     - adds AM or PM            e.g. "PM"
!     - 12 hours time            e.g. "!HH:mm a"
iso   - +v17 returns Date in ISO format
```

items.name: Thelpers.pluralize(zero, one, few, many)
items.body:
The helper pluralizes some count of something.

```html
{{ beers | pluralize('# zero', '# one', '# few', '# more') }}

<!-- +v17 - Supports environments (Array or String values separated by "," comma) -->
{{ beers | pluralize('[beers]') }}
```

- `#` is replaced for the __count__

items.name: format
items.body:
`+v17` enables a specific format for `Date` or `Number` types.

```html
<ui-bind path="some.path.date" config="html;format:dd.MM.yyyy"></ui-bind>

// Or link to environment variable
<ui-bind path="some.path.date" config="html;format:[date]"></ui-bind>

// +v17 supports path to value in the form of environment variables
<ui-bind path="some.path.date" config="html;format:[.path.to.property]"></ui-bind>
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: focus
items.body:
`+v18` supports `focus` command which can contain a __jQuery selector__ which will perform `.focus()`. Example:

```html
<ui-bind path="some.path" config="focus:input">
	<input type="text" value="Focused!" />
</ui-bind>
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: exec
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: .class_name
items.body:
Toggles `.class_name` if the expression returns `true`. You can use multiple `.class_name` commands.

```html
<ui-bind path="some.path" config=".animate:value > 100"></ui-bind>

Multiple:
<ui-bind path="some.path" config=".animate1:value > 100;.animate2:value > 1000"></ui-bind>

items.name: changes
items.body:
`+v18` command performs all other commands only if the value will be changed. It works with `object` types too.

```html
<ui-bind path="some.path" config="changes;html"></ui-bind>
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: checked
items.body:
Sets the `checked` attribute. Targeted for HTML controls only `input`. Expression must return `Boolean`.

```html
<ui-bind path="some.path" config="checked .D:value">
	<input type="checkbox" class="D" />
</ui-bind>
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: class
items.body:
Toggles specified `class` when the `ui-bind` is processed. Epression must be `String` only. Supports multiple classes seperated by empty space.

```html
<ui-bind path="some.path" config="class:hidden" class="hidden">READY</ui-bind>

<!-- Or multiple classes: -->
<ui-bind path="some.path" config="class:hidden ready" class="hidden">READY</ui-bind>
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: click
items.body:
`+v17` Executes method when the user clicks on the element.

```html
<ui-bind path="some.path" config="click:link_to_method"></ui-bind>

<!-- OR WITHOUT PATH -->
<ui-bind config="click:link_to_method"></ui-bind>

<!-- Replaces ? for a SCOPE PATH -->
<ui-bind config="click:?/link_to_method"></ui-bind>

<script>
	function link_to_method(element, event, value, path) {
		// do something
	}
</script>
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: config
items.body:
Performs `reconfiguration` for the current jComponent. Expression must return `String` with jComponent configuration or can return `Object`. ```html
My textbox
etc..
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: delay
items.body:
Delays a binding for 2 seconds. Must be a number which represents `milliseconds`.

```html
<ui-bind path="some.path" config="val .D:value;delay:2000">
	<input class="D" />
</ui-bind>
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: currency
items.body:
`+v18` Renders formatted currency. A value in `currency` command is a currency, it's not evaluated and can be used `[value_from_ENV]`.

```html
<ui-bind path="some.path.to.number" config="currency:eur;html"></ui-bind>

Additional example with a dynamic currency:
<ui-bind path="some.path" config="html:value.price.currency(value.currency);track:price,currency"></ui-bind>
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: disabled
items.body:
Sets the `disabled` attribute. It's targeted for HTML controls only `input`, `textarea`, `select` and `button`. Expression must return `Boolean`.

`+v17` extends `disabled` command for components. Now the library can perform reconfigure with `disabled:true/false` command.

```html
<ui-bind path="some.path" config="disabled .D:value">
	<ui-component name="input" class="D"></ui-component>
</ui-bind>
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: enabled

`+v16` Sets the `enabled` attribute. It's targeted for HTML controls only `input`, `textarea`, `select` and `button`. Expression must return `Boolean`.

`+v17` extends `enabled` command for components. Now the library can perform reconfigure with `disabled:true/false` command.

```html
<ui-bind path="some.path" config="enabled .D:value">
	<ui-component name="input" class="D"></ui-component>
</ui-bind>
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

```html

items.name: required

items.name: setter

```html

items.name: strict
items.body:
This command performs a strict comparing of path. Must be __without expression__.

```html
<ui-bind path="myobj.address" config="strict;html:JSON.stringify(value)"></ui-bind>
```

- allowed paths `myobj` or `myobj.address`
- another paths like `myobj.customer` or something else doesn't affect this binder
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: text

Sets a value as the TEXT content (HTML markup will be escaped). Expression must return `String`.

```html

```

```html

items.name: track
items.body: Enables a strict path comparison for defined paths separated by comma (use a `field` name without parent path). Binder will render the content below if the main path `object` will be changed or specific field (`name` or `price`) will be changed. ```html ```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: tracktype
items.body:
Tracks only changes according to defined `SET()` types. A value can contain multiple values separated by comma.

```html
<ui-bind path="some.path" config="html;tracktype:2"></ui-bind>

<script>
	// Will be binded
	SET('some.path', 'Value', 2);

	// Won't be binded
	SET('some.path', 'Value', 1);
</script>
```

Internal types:

- `0` init value
- `1` manually via e.g. `SET()`
- `2` by input
- `3` default value
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.body:
Sets `value` for the input/textarea/select. Expression must return `String`.

items.name: self.parent([selector])
items.body:
The method is alias for `self.element.parent()`, it gets a parent element.

```js
self.parent([selector]);
// @selector {String} Optional, a jQuery selector
// returns {jQuery}
```

__Possible values:__

- `window` return `Window` object
- `body` return `body` object
- jQuery selector return closest element
- `auto` tries to find an element which has defined `height` in CSS
- `parent` returns `element.parent()`
- `parent1` returns `element.parent().parent()`
- `parent2` returns `element.parent().parent().parent()`

items.body:
You can define multiple servers with Total.js Code editor and usage is very helpful. Electron version offers work with local files and it has improved shortcuts. Electron version is primary targeted for source-code versioning. [Read more](#65c2e002xc50c).

- [Code for MacOS](https://www.dropbox.com/s/6t0fhe08y0bmsgp/code-mac.zip)
- [Code for Windows](https://www.dropbox.com/s/8tabjyqy8zpudep/code-windows.zip)

items.name: Git, Mercurial or SVN
items.body:
Total.js Code doesn't support direct communication with the source-version system. But we have a solution for it. Electron version supports synchronization files from server-side to your local machine and automatically it saves the file locally after you save the file on server.

- you need to [__Download Electron version__](#65c2b001pa51c)
- and you need to choose a synchronized folder
- then the Electron version will store the file

items.name: How to solve CRUD permissions for DB records?
items.body:
Peter Sirka found a unique method how to solve CRUD permissions for existing DB records. The principle is simple, just follow example below. A condition for the permissions can be created through the [`QueryBuilder.permit()`](/dbms/40d00001fc51c/#4e3b9001bo51c) method.

:database: With this permission mechanism you will be able to apply CRUD permissions for:

- __group__ of users
- user __role__
- __userid__

__Example of table__:

```sql
CREATE TABLE "public"."tbl_product" (
	"id" varchar(30) NOT NULL,
	"name" varchar(100),
	-- .........
	"permissions" _varchar,      -- Here will be stored CRUD permissions
	-- .........
	-- .........
	-- .........
	-- .........
	-- .........
	PRIMARY KEY ("id")
);
```

In the `permissions` column will be stored record permissions in the form:

```js
['C@admin', 'W@admin', 'R@admin', 'D@admin', 'R123456', 'R#employees']
```

- first char e.g. `C` means a permission, in this case:
	- `C` create
	- `R` read
	- `U` update
	- `D` delete
- second char `@` means a role name, so e.g. `@admin` means `admin` role
- second char `#` means a group name, so e.g. `#employees` means `employees` group
- otherwise it means  __user identifier__, e.g. `R123456` is a user with id `123456`

__Quick example__:

```js
var user_permissions = ['@admin', '123456', '#employees'];
// @admin     - the user contains "admin" role
// #employees - the user is in "employees" group
// 123456     - means identifier of the user

// We try to find all products where the user has a READ permission
DBMS().find('tbl_product').permit('permissions', 'R', user_permissions);
```

DBMS creates SQL condition in which will be returned all products which:

- `permissions` column is `EMPTY` or `NULL`
- or `permissions` column contains `R@admin` value OR `R#employees` value OR `R123456`

__Another usage__:

```js
// Tries to find all records with "R"userrolegroup, "W"userrolegroup, "D"userrolegroup
// A record must contain just the one permission type
DBMS().find('tbl_product').permit('permissions', 'RWD', permissions);

// Tries to find all records with "R"userrolegroup or user records
DBMS().find('tbl_product').permit('permissions', 'R', permissions, 'userid', myuserid);
```
items.search: how to solve crud permisions for db records
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: How can I extend existing Total.js application?
items.body:
Download [__Flow.package__](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/totaljs/flow/master/flow.package) file from GitHub and copy it here:

```html
$ cp flow.package /yourapp/packages/flow.package
```

- restart app
- open `your.hostname.com/$flow/` URL address in your web browser
items.search: how can i extend existing totaljs aplication
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: Can I trust to Flow pred-defined templates?
items.body:
I think so. Only two peoples have access to GitHub __Flow Components__ repository: __Peter Širka__ and __Martin Smola__. We seriously check each change in the Flow components because we use Flow too.

Do you have any questions? [Contact us](https://www.totaljs.com/contact/).

items.name: Can we use JWT with Total.js authorization?
items.body: __Of course__. `JWT` can be used as the value stored in request cookies or headers.

items.name: Can a bundle contain packages?
items.body: Yes, it can contain packages.
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: Can a bundle contain sub-bundles?
items.body: No, it's not possible.
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: Are the files with same names between bundles and project structure rewritten?
items.body: Yes, they are rewritten according to the project structure because these files have a bigger priority than files in bundles. IMPORTANT: `config` files, `sitemap` file, `versions` file, `resources` files are merged together.

items.name: How can I reset my password?
items.body:
This is not possible via user interface, so follow steps below:

- sign-in to your server via SSH
- `$ sudo su`
- `$ rm /www/superadmin/.src/databases/users.nosql` - remove database `users.nosql`
- `$ cd /www/superadmin/` - open SuperAdmin directory
- `$ bash run.sh` - restart SuperAdmin
- then SuperAdmin will show you new credentials
items.search: how can i reset mi pasword
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: Translation tools: Tracking of new changes
items.body:
Running `total4` with the argument `-diff` will create a resource file with changes between two resources (`newest` texts and `removed` texts).

```bash
$ cd myapp
$ total4 -diff en.resource de.resource
```

Running `total4` with the argument `-diff` will create a resource file with changes between two resources (`newest` texts and `removed` texts).
items.search: translation tols: tracking of new changes
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: Translation tools: Translating text files
items.body:
Running `total4` with the argument `-translate` will create a resource file from the source file.

__Source file `my-translation.txt`__:

```text
Hello World!
I help you
My name is Peter.
Total.js is the web application framework
```

__Open terminal or command-line__:

```bash
$ total4 --translate my-translation.txt
```

__Output `translate.resource`__:

```text
// Total.js translation file
// Created: 2020-12-04 09:58
T1j04vtp          : Hello World!
Tnaa47            : I help you
T1gdb5dj          : My name is Peter.
Tcovmzu           : Total.js is the web application framework
```

Running `total4` with the argument `-diff` will create a resource file with changes between two resources (`newest` texts and `removed` texts).
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: Translation tools: Translating custom phrases
items.body:
Open terminal or command-line:

```bash
$ cd myapp
$ total4 --translate "Hello World"
```

__Output__:

```text
T1krkps4          : Hello World
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: What is configuration for Gmail, Office or Zoho?
items.body:
### Gmail SMTP settings

```resource
mail_smtp                : smtp.gmail.com
mail_smtp_options        : {"port":465,"secure":true ,"user":"ENTER_YOUR_EMAIL","password":"ENTER_YOUR_PASSWORD","rejectUnauthorized":true}
```

__With OAuth 2.0 token__:

```resource
mail_smtp                : smtp.gmail.com
mail_smtp_options        : {"port":465,"secure":true ,"user":"ENTER_YOUR_EMAIL","token":"OAuth 2.0 Access Token"}
```

### Office365 SMTP settings

```resource
mail_smtp                : smtp.office365.com
mail_smtp_options        : {"port":587,"secure":false,"user":"ENTER_YOUR_EMAIL","password":"ENTER_YOUR_PASSWORD","tls":{"ciphers":"SSLv3"}}
```

__With OAuth 2.0 token__:

```resource
mail_smtp                : smtp.office365.com
mail_smtp_options        : {"port":587,"secure":false,"user":"ENTER_YOUR_EMAIL","token":"OAuth 2.0 Access Token","tls":{"ciphers":"SSLv3"}}
```

### Zoho SMTP settings

```resource
mail_smtp                : smtp.zoho.com
mail_smtp_options        : {"port":465,"secure":true ,"user":"ENTER_YOUR_EMAIL","password":"ENTER_YOUR_PASSWORD"}
```

items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: mail_smtp
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: mail_smtp_options
items.body:
Mail settings for `MAIL()` or `LOGMAIL()`, this option sets SMTP options:

- `secure` optional, default: `false`
- `user` optional, default: empty
- `password` optional, default: empty
- `timeout` optional, default: `10000`
- `token` optional, can contain OAuth 2.0 access token in base64 encoding `+v4` (default: `undefined`)
- `heloid` optional, can contain `HELO` or `EHLO` value `+v3.2.0` (default: `undefined`)

```js
mail_smtp_options;
// returns String;
```

__A simple example__:

```json
{"secure":false,"port":25,"user":"","password":"","timeout":10000}
```

__Gmail SMTP settings__:

```resource
mail_smtp                : smtp.gmail.com
mail_smtp_options        : { "port": 465, "secure": true, "user": "ENTER_YOUR_EMAIL", "password": "ENTER_YOUR_PASSWORD", "rejectUnauthorized": true }
```

__Gmail SMTP settings with OAuth 2.0 access token__:

```resource
mail_smtp                : smtp.gmail.com
mail_smtp_options        : { "port": 465, "secure": true, "user": "ENTER_YOUR_EMAIL", "token": "OAuth 2.0 access token", "rejectUnauthorized": true}
```

__Office365 SMTP settings__:

```resource
mail_smtp                : smtp.office365.com
mail_smtp_options        : { "port": 587, "secure": false, "user": "ENTER_YOUR_EMAIL", "password": "ENTER_YOUR_PASSWORD", "tls": { "ciphers": "SSLv3" }}
```

__Office365 SMTP settings with OAuth 2.0 access token__:

```resource
mail_smtp                : smtp.office365.com
mail_smtp_options        : { "port": 587, "secure": false, "user": "ENTER_YOUR_EMAIL", "token": "OAuth 2.0 access token", "tls": { "ciphers": "SSLv3" }}
```

__Zoho SMTP settings__:

```resource
mail_smtp                : smtp.zoho.com
mail_smtp_options        : { "port": 465, "secure": true, "user": "ENTER_YOUR_EMAIL", "password": "ENTER_YOUR_PASSWORD" }
```
items.search: mailsmtpoptions a simple example gmail smtp setings gmail smtp setings with oauth 20 aces token ofice365 smtp setings ofice365 smtp setings with oauth 20 aces token zoho smtp setings

items.name: SITEMAP(id, [first], [language])
items.body:
This method returns item or items defined in `/sitemap` file.

```js
SITEMAP(id, [first], [language]);
// @id {String} identifier
// @first {Boolean} optional, if "true" then returns one value otherwise returns all items in tree-structure (default: false)
// @language {String} optional, localization
```

__First item__:

```js
var value = SITEMAP('sitemap-identifier', true);
value.sitemap     // current sitemap id
value.id          // current item id
value.name        // current item name
value.url         // current item url
value.wildcard    // does the current item url contain a wildcard routing?
```

__All items in tree__:

```js
var arr = SITEMAP('sitemap-identifier');

for (var i = 0; i < arr.length; i++) {
	var value = arr[i];
	value.sitemap   // current sitemap id
	value.id        // current item id
	value.name      // current item name
	value.url       // current item url
	value.last      // is the last item?
	value.first     // is the first item?
	value.index     // current item index in sitemap (in the parent tree)
	value.wildcard  // does the current item url contain a wildcard routing?
}
```

items.name: user.statusid
items.body:
Returns user status.

```js
user.statusid;
// returns Number;
```

__Types__:

- `0` available
- `1` busy
- `2` do not disturb
- `3` be right back
- `4` meeting
- `5` business trip
- `6` holiday
- `7` sick
- `8` off work

items.name: How to send mail message without SMTP server?
items.body:
First you need set `totalapi  : TOKEN` to application `/config` file. Then you can use standard methods `MAIL()` or `LOGMAIL()`.

- __attachments are not supported__ with __TotalAPI__

items.name: Welcome

items.name: OP.appearance()
items.body:
Creates some Openplatform styles (CSS) automatically in your application.

```js
OP.appearance();
```

__What will happen after that?__

- library registers a global JavaScript variable `OPCOLOR {String}` with the user color
- library registers a global JavaScript variable `OPDARKMODE {Boolean}` which determines darkmode
- element `<body class="ui-dark"` will be set automatically if the user has enabled dark-mode
- library creates CSS classes:
	- `opbody` with background color according to dark/light mode and sets it to `<body`
	- `opborder` with `{ border-color: user.colorscheme }`
	- `opborderhover` with `:hover { border-color: user.colorscheme }`
	- `opbg` with `{ background-color: user.colorscheme }`
	- `opbghover` with `:hover { background-color: user.colorscheme }`
	- `opfg` with `{ color: user.colorscheme }`
	- `opfghover` with `:hover { color: user.colorscheme }`
- method registers CSS variable `--opcolor` with the user color scheme
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: How to uninstall SuperAdmin?
items.body:
- stop all apps in SuperAdmin
- kill SuperAdmin using this command `$ kill -9 $(lsof -i :9999 | grep "total" | awk {'print $2'}) > /dev/null`
- to replace `nginx.conf` with backed up file use this command `$ cp /etc/nginx/nginx.conf.backup /etc/`nginx/nginx.conf
- reload nginx service nginx reload `service nginx reload`
- if you added a cron job to start apps at system startup then remove this line `@reboot /bin/bash /www/superadmin/run.sh` from crontab using `$ crontab -e` command
- remove `/www/` folder, this will remove all ssl certificates, nginx conf files, all applications, etc.
- to remove node.js run `$ apt-get remove -y nodejs`
- to remove nginx run `$ apt-get remove -y nginx`
- to remove graphicsmagick run `$ apt-get remove -y graphicsmagick`
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: How can I share a value between threads?
items.body:
Value can be shared between threads in several ways:

- via Total.js events `EMIT2()` which emits `ON()` method in all threads
- via [__REDIS__](https://redis.io/) or [__Memcached__](https://memcached.org/)
- or you can create own light REDIS alternative with Total.js framework via __WebSocket__
items.search: how can i share a value betwen threads
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: @{import(name1, [name2], [nameN])}
items.body:
Imports static files. Works with .js, .css and .ico automatically creates tags `<script>`, `<link>` and `<favicon>`. It supports routing of images or movies without tag creation and supports routing to themes (more in themes section), then head and meta tag rendering.

```html
<head>
	...
	...
	@{import('head', 'meta', 'default.js', 'default.css', 'favicon.ico')}
</head>
```

This method is alternative for `@{js}`, `@{css}` and `@{favicon}`.

__Special values:__

- `manifest` renders link tag to /manifest.json
- `livereload` renders link to livereload script (only in debug mode)
- `head` renders values from `@{head()}` method
- `meta` renders values from `@{meta()}`, `@{title()}`, `@{description()}` and `@{keywords()}` methods
- `components` renders links to components styles/scripts
- `favicon.ico` or `favicon.png` renders favicon link tag

__Merging static files__:

```html
@{import('default.js + ui.js', 'default.css + ui.css')}
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: @{sitemap_change(name, property, value)}
items.body: The method can modify a sitemap. Each rendered sitemap is cached, so therefore this method. ```html @{sitemap_change(name, property, value)} ``` __Example__: ```text homepage : Homepage --> / products : Products --> /products/ --> homepage category : {0} --> /products/{0}/ --> products ``` ```html @{sitemap_change('category', 'url', '/my-custom-url/')}; Category ```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: @{sitemap_name(name, [a], [b], [n])}
items.body:
Returns a URL from `sitemap` file. The method performs `String.format()` for the selected URL address with additional arguments `1..n`.

__Sitemap__:

```text
homepage     : Homepage       --> /
products     : Products       --> /products/        --> homepage
category     : {0}            --> /products/{0}/    --> products
```

```html
@{sitemap_name('category', 'Shoes')};
<!-- OUTPUT: Shoes -->

<!-- next example: -->
@{sitemap_name('category', 'Shirts')};
<!-- OUTPUT: Shirts -->

<!-- next example: -->
@{sitemap_name('products', 'Shirts')};
<!-- OUTPUT: Products -->

<!-- next example: -->
@{sitemap_name('homepage', 'Argument1', 'Argument2', 'Argument3')};
<!-- OUTPUT: Homepage -->
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: @{sitemap_name2(language, name, [a], [b], [n])}

items.name: @{sitemap_replace(name, title, url)}
items.body:
Changes current sitemap `title` and `url` once. The method replaces value only in the memory for the current request.

```html
<!--
E.g.:
sitemap url: /products/{0}/
-->
@{sitemap_replace('detail', model.title, model.linker)}

<!--
With functions:
-->
@{sitemap_replace('detail', current => current.format(model.title), current => current.replace('#', model.linker))}
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: @{sitemap_url(name, [a], [b], [n])}
items.body:
Returns a URL from `sitemap` file. The method performs `String.format()` for the selected URL address with additional arguments `1..n`.

__Sitemap__:

```text
homepage     : Homepage       --> /
products     : Products       --> /products/        --> homepage
category     : Category       --> /products/{0}/    --> products
```

```html
@{sitemap_url('category', 'shoes')}
<!-- OUTPUT: /products/shoes/ -->

@{sitemap_url('category', '')}
<!-- OUTPUT: /products// -->

@{sitemap_url('category', 'first', 'second')}
<!-- OUTPUT: /products/first/ -->
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
Total.js applications can easily call __Total API services__:

- [`TotalAPI()` method](/total4/407ff001jy51c/#6c21e001rs51c)
- [__Get API token__](https://platform.totaljs.com?open=api)

## Example

Edit configuration `/config`:

```text
totalapi    : YOUR_TOKEN
```

__Usage in code__:

```js
TotalAPI('print', { type: 'pdf', html: 'Bla bla bla' }, controller/callback);
// or 
// TotalAPI('YOUR_TOKEN', 'print', { type: 'pdf', html: 'Bla bla bla' }, controller/callback);
```

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
__Total.js Themes__ can help you provide multiple designs with different views, styles, and scripts. - themes are composed of views and static files - themes can contain their static files (the framework maps them automatically) - themes support an initialization script `/themes/THEME_NAME/index.js` - all themes are initialized when the framework is starting - [__Learn from example__](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/themes) __Directory structure__: ```text /themes/THEME_NAME/views/ /themes/THEME_NAME/public/ ``` ::: Initialization file Theme initialization file is optional. - you can declare-initialization file in the form: `themes/THEME_NAME/index.js` - is loaded automatically when the framework is starting __Example__: ```js exports.install = function() { // ... // ... // space for your code // ... // ... }; ``` __The framework initializes its dependencies in order:__ ```text Framework initialization: 01. Bundles 02. Modules 03. Packages 04. Models 05. Schemas 06. Operations ---> 07. Themes 08. Definitions 09. Controllers 10. Components ```` ::: ::: Set default theme This behavior can be defined in `/config` file: ```html default_theme : THEME_NAME ``` ::: ::: Changing theme dynamically Theme can be changed via `controller`: ```js exports.install = function() { ROUTE('GET /', index); }; function index() { var self = this; self.theme('THEME_NAME'); self.view('index'); } ``` ::: ::: Merging & Mapping - the framework identifies `=THEME_NAME` as the full path to __theme__ ```js // Merging MERGE('/merged-script.js', 'default.js', '=THEME_NAME/public/js/default.js'); MERGE('/merged-style.css', 'default.css', '=THEME_NAME/public/css/default.css'); // Mapping MAP('/mapped-script.js', '=THEME_NAME/public/js/default.js'); MAP('/mapped-style.css', '=THEME_NAME/public/css/default.css'); ``` ::: ::: Routing to themes Can be used in these methods: `ROUTE()`, `VIEW()`, `MAIL()`. __Example__: ```js ROUTE('GET /', '=THEME_NAME/index'); // Will be routed to "/themes/THEME_NAME/views/index.html" ROUTE('GET /products/', '=?/products'); // Will be routed to "/themes/DEFAULT_THEME/views/products.html" ``` ::: ## Views ```html
CURRENT THEME: @{theme}
--- @{import('~common.css', 'default.css')} --- is same as: or @{image('logo.png')} ``` __Rendering in controllers__: - `~view_name` will be routed into the root of current theme `/theme/THEME_NAME/views/` - `~~view_name` will be routed into the root of views directory `/views/` ## Public directories __Directory structure:__ ```text /themes/THEME_NAME/public/img/logo.png /themes/THEME_NAME/public/js/default.js /themes/THEME_NAME/public/css/default.css ``` __Listening on:__ ```text http://0.0.0.0:8000/THEME_NAME/img/logo.png http://0.0.0.0:8000/THEME_NAME/js/default.js http://0.0.0.0:8000/THEME_NAME/css/default.css ```

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
__Threads__ are targeted for high-performance web applications. This is our concept of serverless architecture; in __Threads__, each thread inherits a main core of the application, and the developer can develop only functionality for the specific thread. So developers can extend the application by adding new threads, and other threads won't be affected.

- [Learn from example](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/threads)

---

![Threads](/download/a008001km41d-1lzvb0r-1017x654-1.png)

__Good to know__:

- __threads are using unix socket__ (they don't work on __Windows__)
- threads are primarily targeted for REST services
- each thread is executed as an independent thread in the cluster mode
- name of the thread is used as the endpoint
- thread doesn't see another thread because each thread is an independent application
- Total.js will create an initial script for each thread
- if the thread is overloaded, then the main thread opens another thread automatically (if `cluster = 'auto'`)
- if the cluster isn't defined, then the thread is running in single-thread

## How do threads work?

Structure of application:

```html
<!-- IMPORTANT: Main thread doesn't evaluate any code -->
<!-- This definition will be inherited in all threads -->
/definitions/

<!-- Threads -->
/threads/users/
/threads/users/controllers/
/threads/users/schemas/

/threads/products/
/threads/products/controllers/
/threads/products/schemas/

/threads/orders/
/threads/orders/controllers/
/threads/orders/schemas/

<!-- Initial script -->
index.js
```

__Routing__:

```text
http://127.0.0.1:8000/orders/*    ---> is routed to "orders" thread
http://127.0.0.1:8000/products/*  ---> is routed to "products" thread
http://127.0.0.1:8000/users/*     ---> is routed to "users" thread
```

## Start script

__File `index.js`__:

```js
var options = {};
options.threads = true;

// Auto-scale or you can define fixed threads as {Number} for this thread
options.cluster = 'auto';

// Max. allowed threads
options.max = 5;

// A proxy timeout
options.timeout = 5000;

require('total4/debug')(options);
```

## Start script with a prefix for endpoints

__File `index.js`__:

```js
var options = {};

// Before name of all threads will be added a prefix:
options.threads = '/api/';
options.cluster = 'auto';
options.max = 5;
options.timeout = 5000;
require('total4/debug')(options);
```

items.body:
File `/sitemap` is a very helpful tool for generating breadcrumb (navigation) or sitemap. The sitemap file `/sitemap` is a plain text with the same syntax as the framework `config` file. - [Learn from example](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/sitemap) __Good to know__: - file `/sitemap` is a plain text file without extension - is loaded when the framework is initializing - can contain localization markup ### File declaration ```text ID : Name --> URL --> [Parent (OPTIONAL)] ``` __Example__: ```text homepage : Homepage --> / contact : Contact --> /contact/ --> homepage terms : Terms and Conditions --> /terms/ --> homepage privacy : @(Localized Privacy) --> @(/privacy/) --> terms ``` ::: Usage in views __View: `layout.html`__: ```html
@{foreach m in sitemap()} @{m.name} @{end}
``` __View `index.html`__: ```html @{sitemap('homepage')}

@{title}

``` __View `terms.html`__: ```html @{sitemap('terms')}

@{title}

``` __View `privacy.html`__: ```html @{sitemap('privacy')}

@{title}

``` __View `contact.html`__: ```html @{sitemap('contact')}

@{title}

``` ::: ::: Usage in the code - [`SITEMAP()` method](/total4/407ff001jy51c/#6cf8d001fj51c) ```js // Finds only the one item and it returns Object console.log(SITEMAP('terms', true)); // Finds all items in the sitemap tree and it returns Array console.log(SITEMAP('terms')); ``` ::: ::: Usage in routing ```js // Creates route according to the sitemap ROUTE('#sitemap_id', [action], [flags]); // Or without additional arguments. As a view name will be used sitemap_id // IMPORTANT: the sitemap mechanism sets title automatically according to the sitemap ROUTE('#sitemap_id'); // Or with a view name: // IMPORTANT: the sitemap mechanism sets title automatically according to the sitemap ROUTE('#sitemap_id', 'index'); ROUTE('#sitemap_id/products/', [action], [flags]); ROUTE('#sitemap_id/orders/', [action], [flags]); ``` :::

items.body:
< We recommend to use preddefined `AUTH()` behaviour for session management of a user. Read more in [`AUTH()` delegate](/total4/407ff001jy51c/#4893f001wa51c)

__Session__ can help with reading/storing session data. Read carefully the documentation below because the session item contains two identifiers, `id` and `sessionid` (try to understand the difference between the identifiers).

```js
// A default session is initialized
var session = SESSION();

// OR with a specific storage called "orders":
// var orders = SESSION('orders');

// OR with a specific storage called "tokens":
// var tokens = SESSION('tokens');
```

### Session item object

```js
// SESSION ITEM:
{
	id: 'user_id',                             // A main identifier, for example "user.id"
	sessionid: 'session_id',                   // Must be always unique, we use "UID()"
	expire: 'EXPIRATION_DATE',                 // Expiration date, when will the session expire?
	created: 'CREATION_DATE',                  // Internal value
	settings: 'custom settings (optional)',    // It's targeted for specific situations only, so this field can contain special settings (must be STRING!!!)
	note: 'a custom note (optional)'           // Here we can store for example parsed User-Agent (browser name + device type)

	// SESSION DATA:
	data: { SESSION: 'DATA' }                  // A session data, for example in most cases contains a user profile
}
```

- the framework stores on HDD only these fields `id`, `sessionid`, `note`, `settings`, `expire`, `created`
- `data` can be null, and when data is `null`, then the `Session` instance tries to load data via `instance.ondata` delegate
- session DB can contain several same `session.id` in DB but `sessionid` will be unique per each `session.id`

__Good to know__:

- by default, are sessions stored in plain-text files in `databases` directory in the form `sessions_NAME.txt`
- session item contains last usage time, creation date, custom note, and custom settings; this info can be beneficial in several cases
- enables auto-clearing of unused sessions (can be disable via `allow_sessions_unused` option)

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
`ErrorBuilder` is one of the most used parts of the Total.js framework. `ErrorBuilder` handles all errors/exceptions from __Schemas__ or __Controllers__.

__Structure of error in ErrorBuilder is simple__:

- all errors are stored in `instance.items {Array}`
- error looks like this:

```js
[
	{
		name: 'String: error-name-or-error-code',
		error: 'String: error description',
		path: 'String: absolute path to invalid variable',
		index: Number // optional, array index if some item in array is invalid
	}
]
```

__ErrorBuilder__:

- can affect HTTP status code
- can affect content-type for response
- supports custom transformations

`PREF` is meant as user preferences. Some types of components (like j-DataGrid) store user settings to `PREF`. Preferences can be customized; in other words: you can affect behavior for reading/writing preferences. __Loading/Saving__ is performed automatically by the library.

`PREF` is a global variable. Data are read from `PREF` via `PREF.yourkey` with except some reserved keywords.

items.name: Information
items.body:
__Topics__:

- [CRUD operations](#crud)
- [Code list](#code-list)
- [Listing](#listing)
- [Query](#query)
- [Action](#Action)
- [Detail](#detail)
- [Upload](#upload)

## CRUD

This type of source can manipulate with data; CRUD is translated as `Create`, `Read`, `Update`, and `Delete` operations. __CRUD__ source works only with JSON format, so data are received/sent in JSON format.

## Code list

Code list contains `id/text` records in most cases. The code list is meant to be something like a list of countries, currencies, gender types, etc...

## Listing

This type of source is targeted for a listing of data. This source can be used e.g., in `Data-Grid` component, so the user can preview data, paginate, or filter them.

::: Request
Filtering is provided via URL arguments:

- `page=1` page index
- `limit=100` count of items per page
- `sort=column_asc` sorting
- `column_name=VALUE`
	- `string` applies full-text search
	- `number` filters exact numbers
	- `number - number` filters numbers between `number - number`
	- `date` filters date in the form `YYYY-MM-DD` or `DD.MM.YYYY`
:::

::: Response
```js
{
	"page": 1,     // current page
	"pages": 3,    // count of pages
	"count": 300,  // count of items
	"limit": 100,  // items per page
	"items": [{ ITEM_1 }, { ITEM_2 }, { ITEM_N }] // list of items
}
```
:::

## Action

Action source can perform some custom operations with the data.

## Detail

`Detail` source is targeted for reading specific data. The endpoint must return `object` with the data.

## Upload

Upload source is targeted for uploading files.

::: Response
We recommend to keep a response in the form:

```js
[
	{
		"name": "name of file",
		"url": "URL_TO_FILE",
		"size": 343, // in kB
		"type": 'image/jpeg', // content-type
	}
]
```
:::

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
`Builds` are a new feature in Total.js 4. The goal is to create server-side apps in [Total.js AppBuilder](https://www.totaljs.com/appbuilder/) designer. With Total.js AppBuilder, you can create primarily REST services or apps which use data-models or real-time communication via WebSocket.

- [__AppBuilder designer__](https://builder.totaljs.com)
- [Website](https://www.totaljs.com/appbuilder/)
- [Documentation](/builder/)

The output from __Total.js AppBuilder__ is a JSON file containing serialized design architecture and pre-compiled server-side Total.js code. The pre-compiled code is parsed and evaluated as a standard Total.js code.

We had to optimize capturing errors in `builds` because the build is evaluated as a single file spaghetti code. Each non-minified `build` contains special comments used to determine errors more developer-friendly.

## Import builds from URL address

Total.js supports importing builds from the URL address. Just create in `/builds/` directory file with `.url` extension like this:

```html
/builds/app.url
```

And the file must contain the URL address to your build. It doesn't matter what the URL address will include, and the server must return a valid JSON file with the `build` structure.

```text
https://yourdomain.com/build.json
```

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
__Total.js Application Builder__ is an online tool that allows you to create `build` with a pre-compiled Total.js application much more comfortable as never before.

The output form __AppBuilder__ is a __`build`__ - which is a JSON file containing serialized design architecture and pre-compiled JavaScript code (data are encoded in Base64).

- [Empty project: __AppBuilder__](https://github.com/totaljs/emptyproject-builder)

__Minimal requirements__:

- Total.js 4

## How to run Total.js Builder?

::: Total.js Code Editor 

- open Total.js Code Editor
- open your project
- create `builds` directory
- create file e.g. `app.build` file
- and click on it:

![Builds](/download/ag8e001ca41d-zir5pn-253x160-1.png)

:::

::: Total.js SuperAdmin

- open SuperAdmin interface
- click on app options and choose __Open app builder__:

![App builder](/download/ag8d001nw41d-1tlayqn-226x316-1.png)

:::

::: Open builder directly

- https://builder.totaljs.com
- or [Total.js Platform](https://platform.totaljs.com?open=builder)

BTW: you can drag & drop `build` file directly to __Total.js Builder__ or you can attach your design as a URL query argument: `https://builder.totaljs.com/?url=LINK_TO_YOUR_BUILD`.

:::

## How to apply the build file?

Copy your `build` file to your application to `/builds/` directory (and restart the app if the app is in release mode). The build will be automatically processed with the __Total.js framework__.

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
`Views` are HTML files in which you can change content dynamically. Total.js View Engine supports a simple syntax that can affect output. The view engine supports conditions, loops, sections, helpers, and inline helpers. - [Documentation: __View Engine markup__](/total4/720eb001fh51c/) __Good to know__: - a view is the plain HTML file with `.html` extension. - views are synchronous - views are compiled into a function - all views (HTML) are minimized under the compilation - a layout is rendered at last (if it's not disabled) - View Engine can render a view into the raw string - the default layout filename is `layout.html` __Topics__: - [Repository vs. Model](#) - [Defining the layout](#) - [Escaping](#) - [Conditions](#) - [Looping](#) - [Sections](#) - [Assignment values](#) - [Defining helpers](#) - [Defining inline helpers](#) - [Defining custom 3rd compilers](#) - [Date feature](#) - [Defining views in sub-directories](#) - [Localization](#) - [Reading a value from the configuration](#) - [Auto binding values](#) - [A simple routing to static files](#) - [Paths](#) ## Repository vs. Model There are many ways to pass some values from controllers to views. You can transfer data between the controller and the view via controller.repository or `controller.view('name', [model])`. ```js exports.install = function() { ROUTE('GET /', view_homepage); }; function view_homepage() { var self = this; self.repository.firstname = 'Peter'; self.view('my-view-name', { firstname: 'Lucia' }); } ``` A picture describes differences between `repository` and `model`: ![Model vs Repository](/download/a0ha001bh41d-1ywk1lk-810x170-1.png) __Example__: ```html

My View

Get the value from the repository: @{repository.firstname}
Get the value from the model: @{model.firstname}
@{view('partial-view-1', model)}
@{view('partial-view-2')}
``` ## Defining the layout You can create an unlimited amount of layouts and reference them by their (unique) name. A layout works the same as a view. The only addition is the `@{body}` tag. At the location of this tag in the layout, the view will be rendered. __The layout example__: ```html @{meta} @{import('meta', 'default.css', 'default.js', 'favicon.ico')}
@{section('panel')} @{body}
@{view('footer')} ``` ## Defining the view You can create unlimited views. ```html @{meta('Title', 'Description (optional)', 'Keywords (optional)')}
Hello World!
@{view('products', [{ name: 'A', price: 23.32 }, { name: 'B', price: 32.10 }])} @{view('users', model)} @{view('products', [{ name: 'A', price: 23.32 }, { name: 'B', price: 32.10 }, { name: 'C', price: 15.22 }])} ``` ## Escaping The view engine automatically escapes HTML entities. Tag with `@{!` renders the raw value. ```html @{repository.tag = 'Hello World'}
ESCAPED: @{repository.tag}
RAW: @{!repository.tag}
``` __Output__: ```html
ESCAPED: Hello <b>World</b>
RAW: Hello World
``` ## Conditions ```html @{if user === null}
sign in
@{else}
sign up
@{fi}

@{if model.name === 'Peter'} @{if model.name === 'Lucia'}
Here is Lucia.
@{else}
Here is Peter.
@{fi} @{fi}

@{if model.name !== 'Peter'}
Here is @{model.name}
@{fi} ``` ## Looping __Array looping__: ```html @{foreach m in [1, 2, 3, 4]}
@{m}, index: @{index}
@{end}

@{foreach property in model}
@{index}
@{property.name}
@{property.age.format('### ###')}
@{end} ``` __Object looping__: ```html @{foreach m in { name: 'Peter', age: 32 }}
property: @{m.key}, value: @{m.value}
@{end}

@{foreach property in model}
@{index}
@{property.key}
@{property.value}
@{end} ``` ## Sections __View__: ```html @{section footer}
THIS IS FOOTER FROM THE VIEW
@{end}

Homepage


``` __Layout__: ```html .... .... @{body} .... .... @{section('footer')} .... .... ``` __Output__: ```html .... ....

Homepage


.... ....
THIS IS FOOTER FROM THE VIEW
.... .... ``` ## Assignment values __SUPPORTS ONLY FOR:__ `repository`, `model`, `user`, `session`, `query`, `body` and `config`. ```html @{repository.name = 'Peter'}

@{repository.name}

``` __Output__: ```html

Peter

``` ## Defining helpers - __IMPORTANT__: helpers can't be used in view engine conditions `@{if ....` - define them in a definition file ```js DEF.helpers.custom = function(str, num) { // this === controller return str + ' = ' + num; }; DEF.helpers.isTrue = function(value) { return value ? true : false; }; ``` __View__: ```html @{custom('Peter', 25)} @{helpers.custom('Peter', 25)} @{if helpers.isTrue(true)} Helpers in condition. The helper isTrue won't work without helpers keyword. @{fi} ``` ## Defining inline helpers __IMPORTANT:__ helpers can't be used in view engine conditions `@{if ....` The inline helper needs to be defined in the view. ```html @{helper address(street, city)

Address

@{street}
@{city}

@{end}
Address 1
@{address('Baker street 3', 'Wien')}
Address 2
@{address('Galvaniho 3', 'Bratislava')} ``` ## Defining custom 3rd compilers The view engine supports custom (3rd party) compilers. - [How to write a connection to 3rd compiler?](---) ```html

HANDLEBARS

@{compile handlebars}

Handlebars: {{ title }}

{{ body }}

@{end}

JADE

@{compile jade} h3 View engine p Total.js is amazing! @{end} ``` ## Date feature `date` function compares the current date to the date in the argument. ```html @{if date('>', '2015-01-01') && date('<', '2015-01-10 12:00')}
! Happy new year !
@{fi} ``` ## Defining views in sub-directories The default controller `default.js` includes views from the default views directory `/views/`. To modify this behavior, rename the controller's filename (e.g.: `controllers/site.js`) to match a path of the same name under views (e.g.: `/views/site/`). You would display the views contained within the site directory. __IMPORTANT:__ char `~` is very important for mapping the path of views because `~index` is still routed into the `/views/index.html`. ## Localization The framework automatically translates `@(text)` when it is compiling the views. ```html @{meta('@(My custom title)', '@(Description to translate)')}

@(Hello world)

@(Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur ...)

@(#hello)

@(#text)

``` ## Reading a value from the configuration ```html
CONF.name: @{'%name'}
CONF['manager-url']: @{'%manager-url'}
``` ## Auto binding values __Controller's action__: ```js function view_contactform() { this.view('contactform', { Email: '@', Name: 'Anoym' }); }; ``` __View__: ```html Email: @{text('Email')} Name: @{text('Name')} ``` __Output__: ```html Email: Name: ``` ## A simple routing to static files ```html @{import('ui.js')} @{import('ui.css')} @{import('default.css + ui.css')} ``` ## Paths ```js var output = VIEW('someview', ...); // Targeted to --> /app/views/someview.html var output = VIEW('@somepackage/someview', ...); // Targeted to --> /app/packages/somepackage.package/someview.html var output = VIEW('=themename/someview', ...); // Targeted to --> /app/themes/views/someview.html var output = VIEW('~someview', ...); // "~" --> is routed into the root of views (if the controller uses a theme then is routed into the root views of the theme) // Targeted to --> /app/views/someview.html var output = VIEW('#someplugin/someview', ...); // "#" --> is routed into the plugins // Targeted to --> /app/plugins/someplugin/someview.html var output = VIEW('~someview', ...); // "~~" --> is routed into the root of views (if the controller has applied a theme) // Targeted to --> /app/views/someview.html var output = VIEW('./absolute/path/someview', ...); // Targeted to --> /absolute/path/someview.html ```

items.body:
This class contains functions to manipulate images. To use `Images`, you need to have installed [`GraphicsMagick`](http://www.graphicsmagick.org/) (recommended) or [`ImageMagick`](https://imagemagick.org/index.php).

- `Image` is a global variable
- Images are processed in an independent thread
- Output from `Image` object can be a `stream`
- Default converter for images can be defined in `/config` file in `default_image_converter` option
- The framework has prepared several methods for manipulating images:
	- [`controller.image()`](/total4/3e7de001gt51c/#4bc37001fi51c)
	- [`Response.image()`](/total4/4047e002ik50c/#4abfa001hj51c)
	- [`Response.image_fs()`](/total4/4047e002ik50c/#4abfd001yj51c)
	- [`Response.image_nocache()`](/total4/4047e002ik50c/#4abfa001hj51c)
	- [`HttpFile.image()`](/total4/40845001ur51c/#4d80b001kl51c)

__Example__:

```js
var image = Image.load(fs.createReadStream('/users/petersirka/desktop/header.jpg'));
image.resizeCenter(200, 200);
image.grayscale();
image.save('filename');
```

items.body:
The `Mail` module is used to send e-mail messages. The `Mail` keyword is a global variable so that you can use it everywhere in the server-side project structure. __Total.js Mail sender supports__: - TLS - Unsubscribe header - Attachments < __IMPORTANT__:
Total.js framework keeps one open TCP connection to the SMTP server for performance and sending messages from the queue. First, you need to the setup SMTP server in the application `config`: ```resource mail_smtp : smtp.yourserver.com mail_smtp_options : { "secure": false, "port": 25, "user": "", "password": "", "token": "OAuth 2.0 Token" } mail_from : noreply@totaljs.com ``` And then you can send mail messages easily: ```js MAIL('info@totaljs.com', 'Subject', 'mails/view-welcome'); ``` < __Do not you have an SMTP server?__
If you don't have an SMTP server, you can use Total.js API services to sending mail messages. Just set a token to the configuration (in [`totalapi`](/total4/4047c001sd51c/#6d230001yi51c) key), and sending emails will work.

`Counter` is for effective counting things like `views` or `comments`. Values are stored in `TextDB` every 5 minutes (due to performance and saving writing/reading in primary storage). < __IMPORTANT__:
Data are stored by `days` only. `Counter` offers easy methods, it stores `min`, `max`, and `sum` values for each day. __Usage__: ```js COUNTER('pages').hit('welcomepage'); ```

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
__File Storage__ is used for storing and handling uploaded files from web applications. The module offers excellent features. ## How does the FileStorage store files? A file must be stored according to the file identifier. Therefore, we recommend using the `UID()` method as a default identifier. Then the `File ID` is serialized to the `4` chars directory collected from numbers only in the form `1234`, and yes - the FileStorage directory can contain a maximum of __9999 directories__. According to this mechanism, the files are ordered by their identifiers in various directories. Each inserted file contains `2000 bytes` of JSON meta-data. Meta-data contains: - filename - file size - content-type - extension - width - height - a custom app data > :far fa-glasses: __Good to know__:
If you want to read a raw file from the FileStorage, you need to start reading from the offset of 2000 bytes. --- - `FILESTORAGE(name)` is a global method that returns a File Storage instance __Example__: ```js var fs = FILESTORAGE('files'); ```

items.name: How to upload my application via SuperAdmin?
items.body:
SuperAdmin supports `.zip` packages. So you need to pack your application into the `.zip` package in the form:

```text
controllers/...
definitions/...
views/...
config
```

and then you need to upload that package via SuperAdmin:

![Upload](/download/augq001my41d-vktsrs-243x380-1.png)

__ZIP can't contain a directory with the source-code in the root__, this is bad directory structure in the package:

```text
/app/controllers/...
/app/definitions/...
/app/views/...
/app/config
```

__Good to know__:

- SuperAdmin extracts package into the root of the application
- then makes an initialization script
- and then launches it
items.search: how to upload mi aplication via superadmin
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: How to run e.g. Express.js in SuperAdmin?
items.body:
When you register an application, then you need to choose __Type of application__ to __Custom__:

![Express.js](/download/augu002iy40d-1ihg9k8-623x233-1.png)

- then enter your start script

__SuperAdmin__ appends arguments below to the init script automatically:

- `port` number as the first argument
- `mode` debug/release mode as the second argument

SuperAdmin will do something like this in the background:

```bash
node your_start_script 8003 --release
```

items.body:
Welcome to the __Total.js Platform__ documentation. **Total.js Platform** is a unique JavaScript solution targeted at creating rich real-time web applications. The platform is fully open-source, and it offers you - a server-side framework, a client-side library (with a lot of UI components), and complete products written in pure JavaScript. [Peter Sirka](https://www.linkedin.com/in/petersirka/) wrote the entire __platform from scratch__, and he wrote the first lines of code in 2012.

- [Developer Platform](https://platform.totaljs.com)
- [More than 300 UI components](https://componentator.com)
- [Professional support or SLA](https://www.totaljs.com/support/)
- [Live chat with contributors](https://platform.totaljs.com/?app=messenger)
- [__Website__](https://www.totaljs.com)

```video
https://vimeo.com/501322485
```

### Work in progress

This documentation isn't complete at all, but we are continually improving it.

items.body:
Total.js framework loads environment variables from a `.env` file into `process.env` variable automatically. Framework doesn't overwrite values in `process.env`, only extends the variable.

__Good to know__:

- `.env` file is loaded for both modes `debug` and `release`
- Total.js will load `.env-debug` file in debug mode only
- Total.js will load `.env-release` file in release mode only

items.body:
__Following information is related only to v18, or older. If you are using version 19 or newer, please consider this information irrelevant. Scopes are included in ui-plugin.__ __Scopes__ can simplify paths in HTML declaration. In other words: scopes can reduce paths in all nested components. ::: How do scopes work? ```html
Name
Age
Name
Age
``` - first you need to implement an element with `data-scope` attribute - `data-scope` must contain `path` or `?` due to anonymouse scopes ::: ::: __Declaration__ ```html
EXAMPLE:
- method "users_form_init" will be evaluated if the scope will be initialized - {} will be a default value for "users.form"
``` __Options__: - `init:path.to.method` evaluates a method when the scope is initialized `function(scope, el)` - `class:class_name` toggles class for the element - `isolated:true` can enable isolated scope (a parent scope path won't be inherited) - __NEW__: `aclass:true` adds a scope path as a class name - __NEW__: `delay:300` a delay for toggling classes (default: `300`) ::: ::: Isolated scopes with `isolated:true` Independent scopes can rewrite current scope. __Independence__ is enabled by adding `isolated:true` to the scope path `data-scope="products.form__isolated:true"`. ```html
Name
Name
Name
``` ::: ::: Anonymous scope with `?` question mark Anonymous scopes are very good option for creating reusable independent web parts, e.g. `Contact form`, `Subscriber form`, etc.. - jComponent generates random path for this scope - path will have more than 15 chars - path will be stored in `window` object - example: `jmhjxgietazasfazfqxqb` ```html
Name
Name
Name
``` __+v18 supports anonymous plugins:__ ```html
Name
``` __+v18 improved anonymous scopes and plugins with exact path:__ ```html
Name
``` ::: ::: Special usage with `?` question mark Scopes supports one more thing. If the component path will contain `?` question mark in the path, then the scope replaces this `?` symbol with the current scope path. ```html
Street
``` ::: ::: Skip parent scopes `+v17` this behaviour is targeted for special cases. You can skip parent scopes in the form `?COUNT_OF_SKIP`, the example below describes more: ```html
``` ::: ::: __Good to know__ - __IMPORTANT__: scope must contain some components or binders - __scopes__ need to be declared in HTML directly - __scopes__ can have nested scopes - jComponent contains a list of used scopes in `component.scope` - scope DOM element contains the whole path stored in `element.$scopedata` property - obtaining scope with help of jQuery: `$('selector').scope()` returns a scope instance :::

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
`TextDB` is Total.js built-in plain-text NoSQL database system. It's meant for small projects, and you can use the database for storing application logs or some other data. `TextDB` offers two types of plain-text databases __NoSQL__ and __Table__. Both types of TextDB __contain same functionality__ with a different view of storing data. - [Online __TextDB/NoSQL viewer__](https://nosql.totaljs.com/) - :warning: __TextDB__ may not work in the cluster due to single-thread usage. < __Good to know:__
`TextDB` runs in your worker/process in Total.js web applications (outside the main thread). This behavior can be disabled in `/config` file with the option `textdb_worker : false`. ::: NoSQL database This type of `TextDB` stores documents (objects) serialized in JSON format in a plain-text file. Documents are without any schema; the NoSQL database serves as storage for everything except files. - `NOSQL(name)` returns TextDB instance ::: ::: Table database This type of `TextDB` stores documents (objects) with the predefined schema. In other words: you can store documents with fields only that are defined in the Table schema. The table is much faster than the NoSQL database, but it's limited due to the declaring of the schema. - `TABLE(name)` returns `TextDB` instance - each database needs defined schema in `/config` file like example below: __Table schema declared in `/config` file__: ```html table_YOURNAME : id:uid,name:string,price:number,dtcreated:date table_users : id:uid,name:string,email:string(120),dtcreated:date table_products : id:uid,name:string,price:number,dtcreated:date ``` __Supported types__: - `string` - `string(MAX_SIZE)` - `number` can contain integers or floats - `boolean` is stored as `1` or `0`, but parsed as `Boolean` - `date` is stored as time stamp (integer), but parsed as `Date` - `object` is serialized as JSON (we don't recommend to use it due to performance) ::: ### Usage ```js var database = NOSQL('database'); // or var database = TABLE('database'); ```

items.name: APPEARANCE(value)
items.body:
The method sets CSS appearance for the web application. It overwrites/create CSS variables in the form `--key:value`. You can call the method several times, and the method clears previous values.

```js
APPEARANCE(value);
// @value {Object}
```

__Internal keys:__

- `radius {String}` sets CSS variable `var(--radius)` __border radius__ for UI components
- `color {String}` sets CSS variable `var(--color)` __color__ for UI components
- `darkmode {Boolean}` enables dark mode (otherwise will keep light mode)
- `largemode {Boolean}` enables larger mode (otherwise will keep normal mode)

__Example__:

```js
APPEARANCE({ darkmode: true, color: 'red', radius: '20px', size: '20px' });
```

- sets `ui-dark` to `body` element
- overwrites `--color` variable, usage in CSS: `var(--color)`
- overwrites `--radius` variable, usage in CSS: `var(--radius)`
- creates `--size` variable, usage in CSS: `var(--size)`

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
`RESTBuilder` is the right tool for make HTTP(S) requests (to other web applications). With `RESTBuilder`, you can easily execute requests and send/receive various data.

__Usage__:

```js
RESTBuilder.GET('https://www.totaljs.com').callback(function(err ,response) {
	console.log(err, response);
});
```

## Prepared static methods

These methods create instance of `RESTBuilder`.

::: `RESTBuilder.GET(url, [data])`

Creates `RESTBuilder` with `GET` method and `data` are assigned as query data. Of course, query data can be part of URL addresses too.

```js
RESTBuilder.GET('https://www.totaljs.com').callback(console.log);
```

:::

::: `RESTBuilder.POST(url, [data])`

Creates `RESTBuilder` with `POST` method and `data` will be serialized to `JSON` format.

```js
RESTBuilder.POST('https://yourapi.com', { login: 'total', password: '123456' }).callback(console.log);
```

:::

::: `RESTBuilder.PUT(url, [data])`

Creates `RESTBuilder` with `PUT` method and `data` will be serialized to `JSON` format.

```js
RESTBuilder.PUT('https://yourapi.com', { name: 'Total.js' }).callback(console.log);
```

:::

::: `RESTBuilder.DELETE(url, [data])`

Creates `RESTBuilder` with `DELETE` method and `data` will be serialized to `JSON` format.

```js
RESTBuilder.DELETE('https://yourapi.com').callback(console.log);
```

:::

::: `RESTBuilder.PATCH(url, [data])`

Creates `RESTBuilder` with `PATCH` method and `data` will be serialized to `JSON` format.

```js
RESTBuilder.PATCH('https://yourapi.com', { name: 'Total.js' }).callback(console.log);
```

:::

::: `RESTBuilder.HEAD(url)`

Creates `RESTBuilder` with `HEAD` method.

```js
RESTBuilder.HEAD('https://yourapi.com').callback(console.log);
```

:::

::: `RESTBuilder.API(url, operation, [data])`

Creates `RESTBuilder` prepared for Total.js API endpoints.

```js
RESTBuilder.API('https://yourapi.com', 'products_insert', { name: 'Total.js' }).callback(console.log);
```

:::

Other static methods:

::: `RESTBuilder.make(fn)`

This method creates a new instance of `RESTBuilder`.

__Example__:

```js
RESTBuilder.make(function(builder) {
	builder.method('GET');
	builder.url('https://www.totaljs.com');
	builder.callback(console.log);
});
```

:::

::: `RESTBuilder.upgrade(fn)`

This method appends a new `upgrade` method; in other words: you can extend/affect all existing RESTBuilder instances by this.

__Example__:

```js
RESTBuilder.upgrade(function(builder) {
	builder.header('X-Token', 'Your Token');
});
```

:::

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
__Total.js Flow__ (MIT license) is a visual programming interface. It's available as a Total.js package and can be added to any applications based on __Total.js framework__. Flow can be used to add missing or changing already implemented functionality to already existing applications without having to write any code as well as creating new applications. It can be used for connecting the Internet of Things, home automation, web applications, REST services, etc...

- [Total.js Flow on GitHub](https://github.com/totaljs/flow)
- [Website](https://www.totaljs.com/flow/)
- [Try Total.js Flow in Cloud](https://platform.totaljs.com/?open=cloud)
- [Live chat with contributors](https://platform.totaljs.com?open=messenger)
- [Commercial support](https://www.totaljs.com/support/)
- [Service-level agreement (SLA)](https://www.totaljs.com/support/)

__Customizable Flow version__:

- Read more in [__Total.js FlowStream__](/total4/5aed1001bj51c/)

## Requirements

- CPU: 1 core
- Memory: 50 MB
- HDD: 20 MB free disk space
- Linux, macOS or Windows
- Node.js +6
- Total.js framework v3 or Total.js framework v4

## Installation

- Install latest version of [__Node.js platform__](https://nodejs.org/en/)
- [Download __Flow empty-project__](https://github.com/totaljs/emptyproject-flow)
- Run it `$ node index.js`
- Open `http://127.0.0.1:8000` in your web browser

... or install Flow via __SuperAdmin__. There is pred-defiend app template.

### First steps

First you need to install Flow components. Click on the __Database icon__ and install components from pred-defined templates. Then you can create your own Flow.

![Flow components](/download/93qt001af41d-9gb2i6-977x386-1.jpg)

## Source-codes

- [Flow source-code](https://github.com/totaljs/flow)
- [Flow components source-code](https://github.com/totaljs/flowcomponents)

__Examples__:

- [Flow empty-project](https://github.com/totaljs/emptyproject-flow)
- [Flow + Dashboard empty-project](https://github.com/totaljs/emptyproject-dashboard)
- [Flow + Flowboard empty-project](https://github.com/totaljs/emptyproject-flowboard)

items.name: How can I secure my Flow?
items.body:
You have three ways how to do it:

### HTTP authentication

- update `/config` by adding:

```js
package_flow      (Object)  : { auth: ['username1:password', 'username2:password'] }
```

### Authentication by token

- update `/config` by adding:

```js
package_flow      (Object)  : { token: 'YOUR_TOKEN' }
```

Then you need to open Flow designer via URL query argument called `token` in the form `?token=YOUR_TOKEN`, example: `https://127.0.0.1:8000/?token=YOUR_TOKEN`.

### Custom authentication

- update `/config` by adding:

```js
package_flow      (Object)  : { auth: true }
```

Now you need to understand and implement Total.js authorization via [`AUTH()`](/total4/40839001oc51c/) method.
items.search: how can i secure mi flow
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: How can I update Flow to the latest version?
items.body:
__Follow the steps below__:

- Download `flow.package` file from <https://github.com/totaljs/flow>
- Copy this file to `/your_flow_app/packages/` directory
- Restart Flow (if it's running in release mode)

items.name: How to use livereload?
items.body:
It's very easy:

- first enable __Live reload__ in your project settings
- then add the code below to your `view` or HTML file:

```html
<script src="//cdn.componentator.com/livereload.js"></script>
```

If some user will change the code in the Code editor then the code editor notifies your web application about the reloading.

### Special reload for front-end developers

- if some file is changed in `/public/` folder
- if some file is changed in `/views/` folder
- if some file is changed in `/components/` folder

```html
<script src="//cdn.componentator.com/livereload.js" data-type="public"></script>
```

---

- [How to customize live reload for specific files?](/code/65c1c001dt51c/#6d80f001kl51c)

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
__Good to know__:

Most of the API endpoints are generated/returned by the OpenPlatform if the 3rd party app authorizes the request against the platform.

- [Read more in Security section](/openplatform/66d6b002dd50c/)
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
Each __OpenPlatform application__ needs to have implemented a meta file called `openplatform.json`, which contains information about the application. This meta file must be available on your domain because OpenPlatform will download it in some interval.

__Example `openplatform.json`__:

```json
{
	"name": "TestApp",
	"title": "Test application",
	"description": "Some text for the super user.",
	"readme": "Important message for administrators",
	"version": "1.0.0",
	"icon": "check-circle",
	"url": "http://127.0.0.1:8001",
	"author": "Peter Širka",
	"email": "petersirka@gmail.com",
	"roles": ["create", "read", "update"],
	"origin": ["IP_address"],
	"allowreadmeta": true,
	"allowreadprofile": 1,
	"allowreadusers": 1,
	"allownotifications": true
}
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: POST https://yourplatform.com/api/notify/?accesstoken=TOKEN
items.body:
This endpoint creates a `notification`. < __Good to know__:
`URL address` and `TOKEN` are generated by the OpenPlatform. The URL address is defined in the response from the OpenPlatform. ### Request ```request POST https://yourplatform.com/api/notify/?accesstoken=TOKEN Content-Type: application/json { "type": Number, "body": String(1000), // required, simple markdown format "data": String(1000) // optional, additional custom data } ``` __Types__: - `1` - success - `2` - warning - `3` - info --- ### Response Response (200): ```json { "success": true } ``` Response (400): ```json [ { "name": "error-invalid-accesstoken", "error": "Invalid access token." } ] ```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: GET https://yourplatform.com/api/badges/?accesstoken=TOKEN
items.body:
This endpoint creates a `badge` on the application's icon. < __Good to know__:
`URL address` and `TOKEN` are generated by the OpenPlatform. The URL address is defined in the response from the OpenPlatform. ### Request ```request GET https://yourplatform.com/api/badges/?accesstoken=TOKEN ``` --- ### Response Response (200): ```json { "success": true } ``` Response (400): ```json [ { "name": "error-invalid-accesstoken", "error": "Invalid access token." } ] ```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: POST https://api.totaljs.com/check/
items.body:
Returns a current status for your token.

- __API returns__ `JSON` data

__Total.js__:

```js
TotalAPI('check', { ... }, callback);
```

__REST__:

```request
POST https://api.totaljs.com/check/
Content-Type: application/json
X-Token: YOUR_TOKEN
```

#### Response

__Success__:

```js
{
	credits: 34.49
}
```

__Error__:

```js
[{ name: '...', error: '...' }]
```
items.search: post htps:apitotaljscomcheck api returns totaljs rest response suces eror
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: POST https://api.totaljs.com/checkvat/
items.body:
Determines whether is a company VAT payer or no. Works only in European Union.

- __API returns__ `JSON` data

__Total.js__:

```js
TotalAPI('checkvat', 'SK2120417167', callback);
```

__REST__:

```request
POST https://api.totaljs.com/checkvat/
Content-Type: application/json
X-Token: YOUR_TOKEN

{
	"value": "SK2120417167"
}
```

__Input data__:

- `value {String}` required, must contain VAT ID

#### Response

__Success__:

```js
{
	is: true, // Is VAT Payer?
	vat: 20,  // Country VAT
	name: 'Total Avengers s. r. o.',
	address: 'Viestova 6784/28\n97401 Banská Bystrica\nSlovensko'
}
```

__Error__:

```js
[{ name: '...', error: '...' }]
```
items.search: post htps:apitotaljscomcheckvat api returns totaljs rest input data response suces eror
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: POST https://api.totaljs.com/exchangerates/
items.body:
Reads exchange rates.

- __API returns__ `JSON` data

__Total.js__:

```js
TotalAPI('exchangerates', { currency: 'EUR', date: '2020-12-12' }, callback);
```

__REST__:

```request
POST https://api.totaljs.com/exchangerates/
Content-Type: application/json
X-Token: YOUR_TOKEN

{
	"currency {String}": "EUR",
	"date {String/Date}": "2020-12-12"
}
```

__Input data__:

- `currency` is optional, default: `EUR`
- `date` is optional, default: `current date`

#### Response

__Success__:

```js
{

items.name: POST https://api.totaljs.com/mail/
items.body:
Sends a Mail message.

- __API returns__ `JSON` data
- Mail messages are sent from `noreply@totaljs.com`

__Total.js__:

```js
TotalAPI('mail', { from: 'Total.js', subject: 'Subject', to: ['petersirka@gmail.com'], body: 'Your message' }, callback);
```

__REST__:

```request
POST https://api.totaljs.com/mail/
Content-Type: application/json
X-Token: YOUR_TOKEN

{
	"from": "Total.js"
	"subject": "Email subject",
	"to": ["petersirka@gmail.com"],
	"body": "Your message ..."
}
```

__Input data__:

- `subject {String}` __required__, subject
- `body {String}` __required__, HTML body
- `to {String Array}` __required__, with email addresses
- `from {String}` optional, a sender name (not email address)
- `cc {String Array}` optional, with email addresses - CC
- `bcc {String Array}` optional, with email addresses - BCC
- `reply {String Array}` optional, with email addresses - ReplyTo
- `priority {Number}` optional, `1`: high, `5`: low (default: `3`)
- `confidential {Boolean}` optional
- `unsubscribe {String}` optional, URL address to `unsubscribe`

### Output

__Success__:

```js
{ success: true }
```

__Error__:

```js
[{ name: '...', error: '...' }]
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: POST https://api.totaljs.com/print/
items.body:
Prints HTML or URL address to `PDF`, `JPG` or `PNG`.

- __API returns__ `Binary` data
- Max. __512 kB limit__ for HTML and URL content

__Total.js__:

```js
TotalAPI('print', { type: 'pdf', html: 'Your HTML content' }, callback);
```

__REST__:

```request
POST https://api.totaljs.com/print/
Content-Type: application/json
X-Token: YOUR_TOKEN

{
	"type": "pdf"
	"html": "Your HTML content"
}
```

__Input data__:

- `type {String}` required, can be `pdf`, `jpg` or `png`
- `html {String}` optional, HTML content
- `url {String}` optional, URL address to HTML content
- `page {String}` optional, `A3`, `A4` (default), `A5`, `Letter`
- `width {Number}` (in pixels) optional, PDF: page width or Image: browser width
- `height {Number}` (in pixels) optional, PDF: page height or Image: browser height
- `dpi {Number}` optional, only for PDF (default: `96`)
- __NEW__: `margin {String}` optional, only for PDF (default: `0 0 0 0`)
	- in the form `top right bottom left` (values are defined in `mm`)
- `viewport {String}` optional:
	- `xs` extra small display (Mobile phone)
	- `sm` medium display (Table)
	- `md` medium screen
	- `lg` large screen
- `quality {Number}` optional, image quality 
- `orientation {String}` optional, `portrait` (default) or `landscape`
- `grayscale {Boolean}` optional, PDF only
- `lowquality {Boolean}` optional, PDF only
- `zoom` optional, in percentage - default `100`
