items.name: Welcome
items.body: The framework has an excellent mechanism for static versioning files. The versioning is supported via `/versions` file in the app root directory. The versioning is a very great solution for solving of HTTP cache. The versioning file `/versions` is a plain text file and has the same syntax as the framework `config` file. So if you have a problem with HTTP cache, then this feature can save you time. - [Learn from example](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/versions) __Good to know__: - file `/versions` is a plain text file without extension - is loaded when the framework is initializing __Example `/versions`__: ```resource // Auto-create filename according to the MD5 checksum /css/default.css : auto /js/default.js : auto // Precises defined filename /img/logo.png : /img/logo2.png ``` ### Usage ::: Affects all views: ```html @{js('default.js')} --> output will be /js/default2.js @{img('logo.png')} --> output will be /img/logo2.png @{css('default.css')} --> output will be /css/default2.css Output file has to exist or has to be served via `MERGE()` or `MAP()` --> output will be --> output will be --> output will be ``` ::: ::: Affects `MERGE()` and `MAP()` methods: ```js MERGE('/js/default.js', 'scriptA.js', 'scriptB.js'); // Merge will be mapped from "/js/default.js" to "/js/default2.js" MAP('/js/default.js', 'newfile.js'); // File will be mapped from "/js/default.js" to "/js/default2.js" ``` __File: `/versions` with remapping__: < Below solution solves problem with renaming of files. You don't need to rename file `/img/logo.png` to `/img/logo2.png`. The framework automatically creates a file mapping. So in the prax: you change old __logo file__ without renaming. ```text /img/logo.png --> /img/logo2.png ``` The framework performs `MAP()` automatically on the background. :::
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
Total.js supports a great localization mechanism for multilingual websites. - the framework localizes `views` and `.html` static files at compile time - each translated view is stored in memory - you can generate-localization dictionary directly from source-code - text for translation is wrapped in `@(Text to translate)` markup __IMPORTANT__: - localized text can't start with `@(#some text)` phrase; it's considered as an identifier - if your localized text contains `"` or `'` chars, then you need to perform HTML encode because you can use some localized text in JS code - `localization` is applied to all static `.html` files and `views` ::: Initialization To initialize localization, you need to register a localization delegate that obtains language from the request. __`/definitions/localization.js`__: ```js LOCALIZE(function(req, res) { // if "query.language" will be undefined then the framework uses default resource return req.query.language; }); ``` - also `language` can be change in the `controller.language = 'en'` ::: ::: Localization in views ```html @{meta('@(Title)')}

@(Hello world!)

@(Total.js is web application framework for Node.js)

@(#message) or @(#T1c4854) is same as @(Title) (read below)
``` ::: ::: Dictionaries First, install Total.js as a global module `$ npm install -g total4` because NPM registers Total.js terminal / command-line helpers. ### Creating of resource file Open terminal and write: ```js $ cd myapp $ total4 --translate ``` __Output will be__: ```resource // Total.js translation file // Created: 2020-12-04 10:32 // index.html T1c4854 : Title T1y5ksfx : Hello world! Tpfol3 : Total.js is web application framework for Node.js // IMPORTANT: This line was created manually message : Direct reading ``` Total.js finds all texts for translation and creates a resource file `translate.resource` for translation. The keys in the resource file are hashes due to performance and memory consumption. Copy the file: `/resources/sk.resource` and translate it to e.g.: ```resource // Total.js translation file // Created: 2020-12-04 10:32 // index.html T1c4854 : Titulok T1y5ksfx : Ahoj svet! Tpfol3 : Total.js je webový framework pre Node.js // IMPORTANT: This line was created manually message : Priame čítanie ``` ::: ::: Usage Run the app `$ node index.js` and visit: __`http://127.0.0.1:8000/`__: ```html ... ... Title ... ...

Hello world!

Total.js is web application framework for Node.js

Direct reading or Title is same as Title (read below)
... ... ``` __`http://127.0.0.1:8000/?language=sk`__: ```html ... ... Titulok ... ...

Ahoj svet!

Total.js je webový framework pre Node.js

Priame čítanie or Titulok is same as Titulok (read below)
... ... ``` :::

items.name: GET https://yourplatform.com/api/apps/?accesstoken=TOKEN
items.body:
This endpoint returns the app list according to the app privileges. < __Good to know__:
`URL address` and `TOKEN` are generated by the OpenPlatform. The URL address is defined in the response from the OpenPlatform. ## Request ```request GET https://yourplatform.com/api/apps/?accesstoken=TOKEN ``` --- ## Response Response (200): ```js [ { id: String, title: String, name: String, allowreadapps: Number, allowreadusers: Number, allowreadmeta: Number, allownotifications: Boolean, responsive: Boolean, icon: String, color: String, description: String, author: String, type: String, version: String, online: Boolean, mobilemenu: Boolean, dtsync: Date, dtcreated: Date, url: String, // The absolute URL address to meta file frame: String, // The absolute URL address to app (iframe) email: String, roles: [String Array], origin: [String Array], services: [String Array] // Endpoints for the OpenPlatform services } ] ``` Response (400): ```json [ { "name": "error-invalid-accesstoken", "error": "Invalid access token." } ] ```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: GET https://yourplatform.com/api/users/?accesstoken=TOKEN
items.body:
This endpoint returns the user list according to the app privileges. < __Good to know__:
`URL address` and `TOKEN` are generated by the OpenPlatform. The URL address is defined in the response from the OpenPlatform. ## Request ```request GET https://yourplatform.com/api/users/?accesstoken=TOKEN ``` ### URL query arguments __Filtering__: - `id {String}` user idenfitiers separated by a comma `,` - `q {String}` full-text search in the name column - `modified {String}` last modified in the form, e.g. `1 day` (ago), `5 minutes` (ago) - `logged {String}` last logged in the form, e.g. `1 day` (ago), `5 minutes` (ago) - `skipme=true` skips the current logged users - `locality {String}` full-text - `language {String}` full-text - `company {String}` full-text - `reference {String}` full-text - `position {String}` full-text - `firstname {String}` full-text - `lastname {String}` full-text - `middlename {String}` full-text - `phone {String}` full-text - `email {String}` full-text - `group {String}` according to the group - `photo {Boolean}` - `inactive {Boolean}` - `active {Boolean}` - `blocked {Boolean}` - `darkmode {Boolean}` - `sa {Boolean}` - `otp=true` all users with 2FA - `online=true` all online users - `dtupdated {Date}` - `dtcreated {Date}` - `dtmodified {Date}` - `dtlogged {Date}` - `gender {String}` supported values: - `male` - `female` - `statusid {Number}` filters users according to their status: - `0` Available - `1` Busy - `2` Do not disturb - `3` Be right back - `4` Meeting - `5` Business trip - `6` Holiday - `7` Sick - `8` Off work - `contractid {Number}` filters users according to their contract: - `1` Permanent - `2` Contractor - `3` Intern - `4` Part-time - `5` Customer ::: __Special filtering__ - `removed=true` returns only removed users with these fields: - `id {String}` - `reference {String}` - `groups {String Array}` - `contractid {Number}` ::: __Sorting__: - `sort=name_asc` or `sort=name_desc` - multi-sort isn't supported yet __Pagination__: - `page=Number` default `1` - `limit=Number` default `500` (max. `1000`) __Custom fields__: - `fields=name,email` #### Example ```html GET https://yourplatform.com/api/users/?accesstoken=TOKEN&page=1&fields=name,email&q=Peter ``` --- ## Response Response (200): ```json { "items": [user data], "page": 1, "pages": 1, "count": 10, "limit": 500 } ``` __Example of `user data`:__ ```js { id: String, oauth2: String, // if the platform uses OAuth 2.0 connected to another OpenPlatform supervisorid: String, deputyid: String, statusid: Number, status: String, blocked: Boolean, company: String, firstname: String, lastname: String, middlename: String, email: String, phone: String, name: String, // account name gender: String, language: String, position: String, notifications: Boolean, countnotifications: Number, countbadges: Number, colorscheme: String, // hex color background: String, // the absolute URL address to background URL online: Boolean, sa: Boolean, sounds: Boolean, volume: Number, darkmode: Boolean, team: [String], // string array of all teammates identifiers member: [String], // string array of all member identifiers groups: [String], photo: String, // the absolute URL address to photo locality: String, reference: String, dateformat: String, // d: day, M: month, y:year numberformat: Number, // 1: "1 000.12", 2: "1 000,12", 3: "1.000,12", 4: "1,000.12" timeformat: Number, // 24 or 12 dtbeg: Date, // start of employment dtend: Date, // end of employment dtbirth: Date, dtupdated: Date, dtcreated: Date, badge: String, // the absolute URL address for creating badges notify: String // the absolute URL address for creating notifications } ``` - empty strings, `null` values and `false` values are removed from the response Response (400): ```json [ { "name": "error-invalid-accesstoken", "error": "Invalid access token." } ] ```

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
< __OpenPlatform application__ can be created with the help of various server-side or client-side technologies. OpenPlatform doesn't limit you so that you can write an app in `.NET`, `Java`, `PHP`, `Python`, etc. and on the client-side, you can use what you prefer like `React`, `Angular` or our [jComponent library](https://componentator.com). Your application must include OpenPlatform client-side library [openplatform.js](/openplatform/66d6e001na51c/) that allows you to use a lot of built-in OpenPlatform features descripted in [`Client-Side library` section](/openplatform/66d6e001na51c/). ## :far fa-flag-checkered: How to start? You need to create an authorization mechanism that allows using your application in the OpenPlatform. OpenPlatform will run your application with `?openplatform=` query argument containing a URL address to obtain a user profile. < __Are you Total.js developer?__
If you want to use the Total.js framework for your OpenPlatform application, then continue/download with the [__Total.js OpenPlatform app template__](https://github.com/totaljs/openplatform-application) and skip the steps below. __Be careful:__ URL address must be the same as is defined in `openplatform.json`. __Good to know__: - each OpenPlatform application is running under __`

items.name: How to solve invalid origins?
items.body:
OpenPlatform supports three types of mechanism for verifying of the application origin:

1. comparing origin defined in `openplatform.json`
2. comparing resolved IP from application URL address and compared with the request IP from the application
3. __custom__ origin token, __solution__ for this question

---

### How to use origin token?

< :far fa-warning: __Origin token__ disables comparing of origin defined in `openplatform.json` or automatically resolved from the application URL address.

__OpenPlatform side__:

- must be generated/defined in the application form in the OpenPlatform

![Origin](/download/cikx001ri41d-s8anjm-515x449-1.png)

__Application side__:

- each request to the OpenPlatform must contain `X-Origin` header with that token
- if you use Total.js framework with the `openplatform.js` module then you can define `openplatform_origin  : TOKEN` in the `/config` file

items.name: Basic
items.body:
Definitions are files that can rewrite or modify the behavior of the framework. The are commonly used with framework's [`GLOBALS`](/total4/407ff001jy51c/). Definitions are executed/loaded automatically when the application starts. You can create an unlimited amount of definition files. < __IMPORTANT:__
All definition files must be stored in the folder `/definitions/` located in the root of your project. __What can I use definitions for ?__ - initialization of the database - configuring application - creating schedulers - defining of globals variables or methods --- ### Example Definition `func.js` located in `/definitions` directory: ```js FUNC.notify = function(message) { // your code }; ```

items.name: Shortcuts
items.body:
Shortcuts are very important part of Total.js Code editor. You need to remember few shortcuts only (around 8).

- `F1` shows important commands
- `F2` shows parts
- `F3` shows database of UI components
- `F5` reloads the file again from server
- `F6` shows Font-Awesome icons
- `F8` shows projects
- `F9` shows internal chat (+v1.4)
- `F10` shows real-time logs
- `F11` shows cross-project clipboard
- `CMD+F` or `CTRL+F` focuses search dialog
- `CMD+S` or `CTRL+S` saves the content of the file
- `CMD+-` or `CTRL+-` comments selected code

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
Bundles are a significant feature in the Total.js framework. A bundle is something similar to a `.zip` package, but the bundle is a plain text file, and in most cases, it contains an entire project structure with the project files. Bundles have a `.bundle` extension and must be stored in the `/bundles/` directory.

< Most of the __Total.js projects__ are provided as bundles so that when we update the source-code of some project, you only need to update the bundle file. 

::: How do bundles work?

### Bundle structure

```text
/relative/path/to/directory/     : #
/relative/path/to/file/1/        : Gzipped binary file encoded via Base64
/relative/path/to/file/2/        : Gzipped binary file encoded via Base64
```

## How does it work?

Imagine the content of the bundle `mybundle.bundle`, it stores these files:

```text
/controllers/default.js
/definitions/helpers.js
/config
```

And finally, this is the project structure:

```text
/bundles/mybundle.bundle
/definition/db.js
/config
/debug.js
```

If you run the app, then you will update the project structure by adding the `.src` directory and extracted all extracted directories and files from the bundle like this:

```text
/.src/
/.src/controllers/default.js
/.src/definitions/helpers.js
/.src/definitions/db.js
/.src/config
/definition/db.js
/config
/debug.js
```

The framework extracts all bundles + copies all files from the project structure into the `.src` directory. Then the framework runs the app from the `.src` directory.

__Good to know__:

- Total.js framework extracts bundles first
- then the framework (IMPORTANT) merges `resources` and `config` files
- then, the framework copies/rewrites all files from the project directory
- then, the framework runs the app from the `.src` directory (this directory will be as root directory)
- the framework creates a file `/.src/bundle.json` with the project structure (so if you remove/create some file, then the framework updates the` .src` structure automatically)
- `.src/databases` directory is synchronized only for new files; in other words: the framework doesn't modify this directory

:::

::: How to create a bundle?

It's effortless. First, you need to install Total.js as a global module `$ npm install -g total4` and then you can use CLI tool called `$ total4`

```bash
$ cd yourapp
$ total4 -bundle myapp
```

:::

::: Extending of files

If you rename files `--FILENAME.js`, `--FILENAME.css` or `--FILENAME.html`, the framework will merge these files the same file in the bundle (you won't overwrite the extracted files from the bundle).

__Example__:

```text
/bundles/cms.bundle
/themes/admin/public/--ui.js
```

:::

::: External Bundles

Total.js can download a bundle from __URL address__. Just create a plain-text file with `.url` extension in `/bundles` directory:

__File__:

```text
/bundles/cms.url
```

__Content__:

```text
https://cdn.totaljs.com/bundles/cms@14.bundle
```

Total.js downloads the bundle into this directory as `cms@14.bundle` when the framework is starting. So the external bundle will be a part of the `/bundles/` directory. If you restart the app, then the framework will download the bundle again.

:::

::: `.bundleignore` file

Total.js supports the`/.bundleignore` file which can contain a list of ignored rules. This file must be in the root of the app, and its definition is similar to the `.gitignore` file.

__Example__:

```text
/download/*.pdf
/private/*
*.zip
```

:::

items.name: Can I change upload directory for backgrounds and photos?
items.body:
Yes, just append a new config key to `cl_config` table:

```sql
INSERT INTO "public"."cl_config" ("id", "type", "value", "name", "dtcreated", "dtupdated") VALUES
('upload', 'string', 'YOUR_ABSOLUTE_PATH_TO_DIRECTORY', 'config', NOW(), NOW());
```

__IMPORTANT__:

- only new photos will be uploaded to a new directory
- if you want to keep all existing files, just copy `photos` and `backgrounds` directories from the OpenPlatform `public` directory to a new

items.name: Welcome
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
We designed the concept of security for ease of usage for 3rd party applications. When the __OpenPlatform__ launches an app, then appends `?openplatform=` query argument in the form `?openplatform=URL_address` to the URL address defined in `openplatform.json`. The app needs to request this `URL_address,` and the OpenPlatform will return the user profile with some meta-data.

![OpenPlatform](/download/95ay001yt41d-1u0ss3z-521x111-1.png)

## Security elements

- a domain name
- application's server IP address (origin)

If the application is registered to the OpenPlatform then the OpenPlatform resolves IP addresses of the app domain immediately, and it extends the origin list by adding of additional `origin` list defined in the app `openplatform.json`.

So if the application performs a request for obtaining a user profile, then the OpenPlatform compares a requested IP with the `origin` list stored in OpenPlatform, after that then returns a user profile according to the application privileges, otherwise is request unauthorized.

## Tokenization

OpenPlatform sends to each application a unique token. The token is generated from several elements:

- user `accesstoken` + user `verifytoken` + user `identifier`
- app `accesstoken` + app `identifier`
- openplatform `accesstoken`

User's `verifytoken` is still generated new when the user signs-in to the OpenPlatform. Tokens stored in `accesstoken` are generated when the User or App or OpenPlatform is initialized for the first time. The token can be re-generated via administrator again with the help of UI.

__Security elements__:

- OpenPlatform compares request `origin` between the app `origin` stored in OpenPlatform (you can define origin manually as a token or by default the OpenPlatform tries to obtain origin automatically from DNS resolver)
- if the app sends an invalid token more than ten times, then OpenPlatform blocks this app for 10 minutes
- app can't download data while the user is offline

## Response from the OpenPlatform

The object below is returned from OpenPlatform if you call tokenization:

```json
{
	"date": "2020-12-08T07:29:41.345Z",
	"ip": "78.98.116.204",
	"url": "https://......",

	// Security element
	// An application identifier from the OpenPlatform
	"id": "353621001ek1a",

	// Security element
	// Link to OpenPlatform
	"openplatform": "https://......com",

	// OpenPlatorm ID
	// Identifier is computed from CRC32(the OpenPlatform URL address)
	"openplatformid": 3343195631,

	// OpenPlatform email address (e.g. to administrator)
	"email": "info@totaljs.com",

	// Name of the OpenPlatform
	"name": "Total.js",

	// OpenPlatform version
	"version": 4900,

	// Security element
	// Optional, serial number
	"sn": "XXXXXX"

	// Security element
	// Optional, a verification token (by default is generated randomly)
	"verifytoken": "XXXXXX"

	// User profile
	"profile": {

		// User identifier
		"id": "8zud001fr41d",

		// OAuth 2.0 identifier if OpenPlatform uses OAuth 2.0 connected
		// to another OpenPlatform
		"oauth2": "",

		"directoryid": 0,
		"statusid": 0,
		"status": "I'm working 24/7",
		"company": "Total Avengers",
		"dtbirth": "1984-11-06T00:00:00.000Z",
		"dtcreated": "2020-11-18T10:00:52.075Z",
		"dtupdated": "2020-12-03T21:59:51.034Z",
		"firstname": "Peter",
		"lastname": "Širka",
		"name": "Peter Širka",
		"email": "....",
		"phone": "....",
		"gender": "male",
		"language": "en",
		"position": "Developer",
		"notifications": true,
		"online": true,
		"photo": ".......",
		"locality": "Slovakia",
		"dateformat": "dd.MM.yyyy",
		"numberformat": 1,
		"timeformat": 24,
		"countnotifications": 0,
		"countbadges": 0,
		"colorscheme": "#4285f4",
		"background": "",
		"darkmode": false,
		"roles": ["admin", "support"],
		"groups": ["administrators", "sa"],
		"sa": true,
		"sounds": true,
		"volume": 50,
		"member": ["UID", "UID"], // Nullable, it includes user identifiers where the current user is defined as a member
		"team": ["UID", "UID"],   // Nullable, it includes user identifiers of all defined members in the current user
		"badge": "https://......./api/badges/?accesstoken=blablablabla",
		"notify": "https://......./api/notify/?accesstoken=blablablabla"
	},

	// URL address for obtaining of OpenPlatform meta information
	// Read more in the API section
	"meta": "https://......./api/meta/?accesstoken=blablablabla",

	// URL address for obtaining of all users from OpenPlatform
	// Read more in the API section
	"users": "https://......./api/users/?accesstoken=blablablabla",

	// URL address for obtaining of all users from OpenPlatform
	// Read more in the API section
	"apps": "https://......./api/apps/?accesstoken=blablablabla",

	// URL address for callinng OpenPlatform services
	// Read more in the API section
	"services": "https://......./api/services/?accesstoken=blablablabla",

	// Modified custom application settings defined in "openplatform.json"
	"settings": {
		"showusers": false,
		"videocall": false,
		"private_message": true
	}
}
```

- most of the fields are optional
- __IMPORTANT__: OpenPlatform returns fields according to app privileges
- fields which are `empty`, `false`, `null` or `undefined` aren't sent


## Verifying of response

> __You don't need to read this section if you use the Total.js OpenPlatform module in your 3rd party application.__

You have several ways to verify the response from the OpenPlatform due to a fake simulation of the OpenPlatform.

< Significant is the first request to your application from the OpenPlatform. You need to remember several factors from the response.

Response from the OpenPlatform contains:

```json
{
	...
	"id": "353621001ek1a",
	"openplatform": "https://......com",
	"openplatformid": 3343195631,
	"sn": "XXXXXX",
	"verifytoken": "XXXXXX"
	...
}
```

### 1. factor: Compare URL addresses

Your app must call the OpenPlatform for verifying of user. If you obtain response from the OpenPlatform you need to compare a value from the `openplatform` key in the response from the tokenization URL address.

__Example__:

```request
GET https://fakeopenplatform.com/verify/?accesstoken=XXX
```

```json
{
	...
	...
	"openplatform": "https://simulator.totaljs.com",
	"openplatformid": 3343195631
	...
	...
}
```

You can see, the `openplatform` key contains `https://simulator.totaljs.com`, but the request has been created to `https://fakeopenplatform.com`.

### 2. factor: Check `verifytoken`

You need to store somewhere verification token stored in the `verifytoken` key from the response of the first request to the OpenPlatform. Then it's easy to compare verification tokens. An attacker doesn't know the verification token from the OpenPlatform.

### 3. factor: Serial number `sn`

Same as verifying tokens, you can compare serial numbers between your app and OpenPlatform. Your application can provide a serial number to the OpenPlatform if the app is registering.

### 3. factor: App ID

You need to store somewhere `appid` stored in the `id` key from the response of the first request to the OpenPlatform. Then it's easy to compare identifiers. An attacker doesn't know `appid` from the OpenPlatform.

### 5. factor: Origin token

The admin can create an `Origin token` until he registers the app. This origin token must be sent with each request to the OpenPlatform in the `X-Origin` header from your 3rd party app. Also, OpenPlatform sends this origin token (in the `X-Origin` header too) in the verifying of the `accesstoken` response.
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: How to secure my app much better?
items.body:
You have several ways how to secure the app much better.

- use serial numbers
- use origin tokens
- define allowed platforms in [`openplatform.json`](/openplatform/66d69001tl51c/#68381001df51c)

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
__OpenPlatform__ (MIT license) is a simple enterprise-ready platform for running, integrating, and managing multiple 3rd party web applications. In short: __OpenPlatform__ is a simple container for users and third-party applications independent of the client-side/server-side technology.

- [__OpenPlatform website__](https://www.totaljs.com/openplatform/)
- [Repository on GitHub](https://github.com/totaljs/openplatform/)
- [Need help? __Professional support__](https://www.totaljs.com/support/)
- [Live chat with contributors](https://platform.totaljs.com?app=messenger)
- [Commercial support](https://www.totaljs.com/support/)
- [Service-level agreement (SLA)](https://www.totaljs.com/support/)

***

![OpenPlatform](/download/910o002fl40d-3yqwcn-1280x910-1.jpg)

## Installation

- Install latest version of [__Node.js platform__](https://nodejs.org/en/)
- Install latest version of [__GraphicsMagick__](http://www.graphicsmagick.org/)
- Install PostgreSQL
- Create a database for OpenPlatform
- Import `database.sql`
- Install NPM dependencies via terminal `$ npm install` in the root of application
- Update connection strings in `/config` file
- [Download __Source-Code__](https://github.com/totaljs/openplatform) or [Download __bundle__](https://github.com/totaljs/openplatform-bundle)
- Run it `$ node debug.js`
- Open `http://127.0.0.1:8000` in your web browser
- :fa fa-warning: __IMPORTANT__: Then open settings and configure the platform

Default credentials:

```secret
- login     : __admin__
- password  : __admin__
```

## Localization

According to your language, download the file below, unzip, translate and store it as `/resources/en.resource`.

- [Download __en.resource__](https://github.com/totaljs/openplatform/blob/master/en.resource)
- rename it according to the language `en.resource` or `de.resource` or etc.

items.name: POST https://yourplatform.com/api/services/?accesstoken=TOKEN&service=SERVICE&app=APP
items.body:
This endpoint performs a request to another application. < __Good to know__:
`URL address` and `TOKEN` are generated by the OpenPlatform. The URL address is defined in the response from the OpenPlatform. ## Request ```request POST https://yourplatform.com/api/services/?accesstoken=TOKEN&service=SERVICE&app=APP Content-Type: Defined by the developer Raw body data ``` __Required query arguments__: - `service {String}` service identifier, it's part of meta file (__required__) - `app {String}` app identifier (__required__) __Example__: ```request POST https://yourplatform.com/api/services/?accesstoken=TOKEN&service=create&app=orders Content-Type: application/json {"name":"Hello world!"} ``` ## Response Response depends on the service. __Response (400):__ ```json [ { "name": "error-invalid-accesstoken", "error": "Invalid access token." } ] ```
items.creator: Peter Širka

You need a `TOKEN` for calling of Total.js API services:

- [__Get API token__](https://platform.totaljs.com?open=api)

items.name: AUDIT([name], $, message, [type])
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: $.audit(message, [type])
items.body:
This method creates audit log.

```js
$.audit(message, [type]);
// @message {String} required
// @type {String} optional, can contain "info" (default), "warning", "error" or "success"
```

The `message` argument can contain dynamic variables:

- `{user.key}` reads a value from the user session
- `{data.key}` reads a value from insert/update data
- `{model.key}` reads a value from the model
- `{query.key}` reads a value from the query URL arguments
- `{params.key}` reads a value from the routing params

__Example__:

```js
$.audit('Shut up and take my money!');
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: POST https://api.totaljs.com/logger/
items.body:
Adds a log message to the Total.js Platform logger.

- Max. __50 kB limit__ of payload

__Total.js__:

```js
TotalAPI('logger', { app: 'Platform', type: 'info', message: 'Your custom message' }, callback);
```

__REST__:

```request
POST https://api.totaljs.com/logger/
Content-Type: application/json
X-Token: YOUR_TOKEN

{
	"app": "Platform", 
	"type": "info"
	"message": "Your custom message"
}
```

__Input data__:

- `type {String}` required, can be `info` (default), `warning`, `error` or `success`
- `message {String(500)}` required, a custom message
- `app {String(40)}` required, app name
- `url {String(100)}` optional, URL address
- `reference {String(50)}` optional, a custom reference
- `data {JSON}` optional, a custom serialized data
- `schema {String(50)}` optional, `A3`, `A4` (default), `A5`, `Letter`
- `ua {String(30)}` optional, user-agent
- `ip {String(60)}` optional, IP address
- `userid {String(25)}` optional, a user identifier
- `username {String(50)}` optional, a user name

---

### Total.js implementation

```js
DEF.onAudit = function(name, data) {
	data.sessionid = data.thread = undefined;
	data.app = CONF.name;
	TotalAPI('logger', data, ERROR('totalapi'));
};
```
items.creator: Peter Širka

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
## Total.js AppMonitor We offer you free monitoring of your Total.js applications.
More information on the [AppMonitor website](https://www.totaljs.com/appmonitor/). __Install instructions__: - [Download the `monitor.js` module](https://github.com/totaljs/modules/tree/master/monitor) - [Register your app in the AppMonitor](https://platform.totaljs.com?open=monitor) < __IMPORTANT:__
Total.js AppMonitor won't work with local URL addresses. The app must be available on an existing domain name. ## Total.js API services We have prepared several __API services__ with fair prices, which can help you create your web applications. You can call API services with the help of the [`TotalAPI()` method](/total4/407ff001jy51c/#6c21e001rs51c). - [__Get API token__](https://platform.totaljs.com/?open=api) - [Pricing](https://platform.totaljs.com/?open=api) - [Documentation: API services](/totalapi/6c221003eo51c/#6c225001ga51c) - [All supported API services](/totalapi/6c221003eo51c/)

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
__LDAP__ beta is a simple tool that synchronizes users via LDAP to the OpenPlatform.

![LDAP](/download/dgv6001fy41d-11vs492-624x728-1.png)

- OpenPlatform stores full __dn__ of each user in `dn` field
- OpenPlatform sets `inactive` state to the unsynchronized users in LDAP for users who have synchronized via LDAP before
- LDAP user can't change their login name and password

items.name: LOAD(types, [path], [callback])
items.body:
This method loads the framework without HTTP server.

```js
LOAD([parts], [path], [callback]);
// @parts {String Array or String} loads only specific parts
// @path {String} A startup path (optional, default project structure)
// @callback {Function} A callback function, it's executed when the project is loaded correctly
```

__Parts__:

- `debug` enables debug mode (otherwise it will use `release` mode)
- `bundles` loads bundles
- `components` loads components
- `controllers` loads controllers
- `definitions` loads definitions
- `modules` loads modules
- `packages` loads packages
- `models` loads models
- `schemas `loads schemas
- `operations `loads operations
- `sources` loads sources
- `plugins` loads plugins
- `preferences` loads preferences
- `tasks` loads tasks
- `themes` loads themes
- `service` loads background service `ON('service')` and scheduler

__Possible other parts__:

- `nobundles`
- `nopackages`
- `nocomponents`
- `nothemes`

If you don't specific types then the is loaded in the mode all types without:

- `bundles`
- `packages`
- `components`
- `themes`

__A simple example__:

```js
LOAD(function() {
	// Framework is loaded
});
```

__Loads specific parts__:

```js
LOAD('definitions, schemas', function() {
	// Framework is loaded
});
```

items.name: How to renew SSL for the SuperAdmin?
items.body:
__Instructions__:

- open SuperAdmin directory `$ cd /www/superadmin`
- then run script `$ bash ssl.sh YOUR_DOMAIN --renew`
- then try NGINX configuration `$ nginx -t`
- and when it's everything OK, then perform `$ nginx -s reload`

Done.

items.name: String.toJSONSchema([name], [url])
items.body:
Returns JSON schema according to the defined inline schema.

```js
String.toJSONSchema([name], [url])
// @name {String} optional, name of the schema (default: CONF.name)
// @url {String} optional, URI for the schema (default: CONF.url)
// returns Object;
```

Data schema supports all basic types + arrays:

- `number`
- `tinyint`
- `smallin`
- `number`
- `boolean`
- `string`
- `guid`
- `uid`
- `date`
- `string`
- `email`
- `zip`
- `phone`
- `url`
- `json`
- `base64`
- `lowercase`
- `uppercase`
- `capitalize`
- `capitalize2`
- `icon` supports only Total.js Icons or Font-Awesome
- `color` must be defined in HEX
- __NEW__ supports enums in the form `{enumA|enumB|enumC}`
- __NEW__ supports nested objects in the form `{ name:String, age:Number }`
- __NEW__ supports nested object arrays in the form `[name:String, age:Number]`
- __NEW__ supports linkers to other Total.js Schemas `name:@Profile, address:@Address`

The schema must be defined in the form: `name:String, age:Number` separated by the comma or newline. If you want to have something required e.g. `name` field, then use: `*name:String`. Array must be defined like `[String]`. The schema is designed for one-level defined properties/fields.

- fields starting with the `*` char are required

__Example__:

```js
var schema = '*name:String, age:Number, *email:Email'.toJSONSchema('user');
var output = schema.transform({ name: 'Total.js' });
console.log(output);
// { error: ..., response: ... }
```

items.name: LOCALIZE(dictionary)
items.body:
`+v18` The method creates a dictionary from the `dictionary` argument to the localization. The method will parse the `dictionary` automatically to the jComponent internal dictionary `DEF.dictionary`. Syntax must be save as [Total.js Resource Files](/total4/4083b001sd51c/).

```js
LOCALIZE(dictionary);
// @dictionary {String} it's a special text format according to the Total.js Resource Files documentation
```

__Example__:

```js
LOCALIZE(`T1a2kjx             : Tlačiť
T1c4m9              : Pomocník`);
```

Data is stored in `DEF.dictionary`.

__Good to know__:

- How to create dictionary? Follow: https://docs.totaljs.com/total4/4083e003yi51c/#7a22a001rb51c

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
__SuperAdmin__ (MIT license) is a visual Node.js application management tool for providing (primary) Total.js applications on Linux servers. It uses [NGINX webserver](https://nginx.org) as reverse proxy and [Let's encrypt](https://letsencrypt.org/) for generating of SSL certificates.

This documentation is created for `SuperAdmin v9`, which is fully optimized only for `Total.js v4`.

- [Total.js Flow on GitHub](https://github.com/totaljs/superadmin)
- [Website](https://www.totaljs.com/superadmin/)
- [Live chat with contributors](https://platform.totaljs.com?app=messenger)
- [Commercial support](https://www.totaljs.com/support/)
- [Service-level agreement (SLA)](https://www.totaljs.com/support/)

## New installation

:far fa-cloud-upload: __Total.js Cloud__:

Just sign-in to the Total.js Platform interface, open the Cloud app and create a container. Our Total.js Cloud services will create a new Total.js container with preinstalled SuperAdmin.

- [Total.js Cloud](https://platform.totaljs.com/?open=cloud)

---

Installation of __SuperAdmin__ is effortless; just run the below command on your __Linux server__. We recommend installing SuperAdmin on a new and clean Linux server.

__Ubuntu Server +16 / Debian Server__:

```sh
$ wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/totaljs/superadmin/master/install.sh && bash install.sh
```

__CentOS__:

```sh
$ wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/totaljs/superadmin/master/install-centos.sh && bash install.sh
```

__Alpine Linux__:

```sh
$ wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/totaljs/superadmin/master/install-alpine.sh && bash install.sh
```

Do you have any problem? [Contact us](https://platform.totaljs.com/?open=messenger)

## Upgrade old SuperAdmin to v9

Upgrading of __SuperAdmin__ to the latest version is possible, but you need to carefully perform some steps.

__Good to know__:

- All alarms will be removed, you will need to define new alarms
- Script will create a backup of old version of SuperAdmin as `/www/superadmin_bk.zip`

__Ubuntu Server +16 / Debian Server__:

```sh
$ sudo su
$ wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/totaljs/superadmin/master/update.sh && bash update.sh
```

__CentOS__:

```sh
$ sudo su
$ wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/totaljs/superadmin/master/update-centos.sh && bash update.sh
```

Do you have any problem? [Contact us](https://platform.totaljs.com/?open=messenger)

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
The module can simplify work with __OpenPlatform__ in your Total.js web apps on the server-side. < __Good to know:__
This module will work only with the Total.js framework. - [Download module `openplatform.js`](https://github.com/totaljs/modules/tree/master/openplatform) ## Features - the module reads `openplatform.json` from root of the application - it can modify `openplatform.json` dynamically - it reads meta-data - it handles user synchronization very effective #### Origin token Origin token is alternative to __origin__ defined in the `openplatform.json` file. Origin token must be generated in the OpenPlatform and that token must be in the `/config` under `openplatform_origin : TOKEN` key. - [How to solve invalid origins?](/openplatform/7e801001hd51c/#8e90b001et51c) - just append `openplatform_origin : YOUR_TOKEN` to the `/config` file #### Meta file The module can affect the meta file dynamically. Therefore, you don't need to enter, e.g. URL address, and the module will obtain the hostname directly from the request to the app. ```json { ... ... ... url: '@/admin/' // the module will replace @ with a hostname from the first request to the app // or keep openplatform.json without "url" key ... ... ... } ``` __Good to know__: - the module will obtain the URL address or replace `@` in the URL address field automatically - the module will copy the `name` key to the `CONF.name` as the app name

items.name: def
items.body:
Sets the `def` attribute. It's targeted for HTML controls only `input`, `textarea`, `select` and `button`.

```html
String:
<ui-bind path="some.path" config="def:'String';html:JSON.stringify(value)"></ui-bind>

Number:
<ui-bind path="some.path" config="def:100;html:JSON.stringify(value)"></ui-bind>

Boolean:
<ui-bind path="some.path" config="def:true;html:JSON.stringify(value)"></ui-bind>

Object:
<ui-bind path="some.path" config="def:{};html:JSON.stringify(value)"></ui-bind>

Array:
<ui-bind path="some.path" config="def:[];html:JSON.stringify(value)"></ui-bind>
```

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
## Total.js Message Service (TMS) __TMS__ is a simple PUB/SUB architecture that can integrate your __Total.js App__ with the [Total.js Flow](https://www.totaljs.com/flow/). The entire algorithm is built on top of JSON schemas. < __Good to know__
Total.js framework supports auto-convertor for Total.js Schemas to the JSON schemas. ![TMS](/download/gdc9001dh41d-yg1p6t-0x0-1.jpg) __How to integrate TMS into the Total.js app?__ - [Total.js TMS Example](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/tms) ## Methods If you want to use Total.js Message Service in your Total.js app, you need to register all publishers and subscribers. Total.js framework will create a TMS schema in the background, and the framework will send this schema into the TMS Integrator/FlowStream app. If you register or unregister Pub/Sub, the TMS schema will be refreshed automatically, and the framework will notify all connected TMS Integrator/FlowStream apps. All data are transformed according to the registered JSON schema. __Registering PUB/SUB__: - [`NEWPUBLISH(name, schema)`](/total4/407ff001jy51c/#a6eb8001bp51c) - [`NEWSUBSCRIBE(name, schema)`](/total4/407ff001jy51c/#a6eb9001fo51c) - [`NEWCALL(name, schema, callback)`](/total4/407ff001jy51c/#b4e62001kr51c) __Communication__: - [`PUBLISH(name, data)`](/total4/407ff001jy51c/#a6ebf001tj51c) - [`SUBSCRIBE(name, callback)`](/total4/407ff001jy51c/#a6ec1001uu51c) ## Total.js TMS Client Total.js framework supports __TMS Client__ that can help you integrate Total.js Apps (with TMS) in the code. - Read more in [__TMS Client section__](/total4/ba783001gi51c/)

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
Total.js supports clusterization with the help of __Node.js Cluster__, but your application needs to be optimized for it. __Cluster__ clones your application virtually to independent threads (instances); in other words: from your single-thread application will be a multi-thread application. Each request is processed randomly between open threads.

__What will be with the WebSocket clients?__

WebSocket clients will be divided into all instances so that each instance will have only its own clients. If a client sends a message, this message will be processed only with the instance where the client is (other instances won't see this message).

< You need to know that you can process one request via `Thread 1` and a second request from the same client can be processed via, e.g. `Thread 4`.

## Good to know

- Total.js supports an auto-scale mode
- you can use-Cluster in `debug` mode

![Cluster](/download/9zy0001ts41d-1cgv5e7-537x400-1.png)


##  How to run Total.js application in cluster?

__Auto-scalling mode__:

```js
const options = {};
options.cluster = 'auto';
options.cluster_limit = 10;
require('total4/release')(options);
```

__Fixed count of threads__:

```js
const options = {};
options.cluster = 5; // opens 5 threads
require('total4/release')(options);
```

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
Total.js 4 framework supports two live reload modes. < **IMPORTANT**
Both modes only work under the `debug` mode. Follow the example below: - [Example: __Live reload__](https://github.com/totaljs/examples/tree/master/livereload) ## Localhost Total.js will run an independent and hidden app with the Live reload server that reacts to the changes. You will need to inject only a tiny JS file `` that will respond to all changes. First of all, follow the [start script options](https://github.com/totaljs/framework4/blob/master/helpers/index.js). Then you can update start script by adding: ```js // Total.js will run another hidden process with the Live reload server on the port: 35729 options.livereload = true; ``` If you develop multiple Total.js apps on the `localhost`, you can specify a `port` number for each app like the example below. Don't forget to change the port number in the `data-url` attribute on the client-side script. ```js // Total.js will run Live reload server on the port "35730" options.livereload = 35730; ``` ## Server-side If you develop apps on the server-side, your Total.js app will connect to our live reload server `livereload.totaljs.com`. Then you will need to inject only a tiny JS file `` that will respond to all changes. The significant part is to type a `hostname` of your web application. According to the hostname are paired all connected clients. __Start script__: ```js // Total.js will connect to our server "livereload.totaljs.com?hostname=www.totaljs.com" options.livereload = 'www.totaljs.com'; ``` The client-side live script is set automatically to our live reload server, and it automatically appends `?hostname=location.origin` for your web app.

items.body:
__Total.js Web Components__ are built on __Total.js UI Library__ - a client-side library for creating reusable UI components with many powerful features. UI library contains everything you need to create __Single Page Applications__. - :far fa-life-ring #E73323: [__Free online chat support__](https://t.me/totaljs/6032) < __Do you know?__
All Total.js products use the __Total.js UI library__. - [__Guidelines__](/welcome/67b47001ty51c/) - [Commercial support](https://www.totaljs.com/support/) - [__Download free UI components__](https://componentator.com/) - [Live chat with contributors](https://platform.totaljs.com?app=messenger) - [Commercial support](https://www.totaljs.com/support/) - [Service-level agreement (SLA)](https://www.totaljs.com/support/) - [GitHub repository](https://github.com/totaljs/jComponent) ## Library The UI library contains a rich collection of various components to be used in many different cases. The main point of UI library was creating reusable UI Web Components without any complicated tools or dependencies. __Includes__: - [UI components](https://componentator.com/) - [Icons](https://componentator.com/icons/) - A small count of predefined CSS ## CDN We have prepared CDN for UI library. We update all libraries regularly. - [Browse __Total.js Icons__](https://componentator.com/icons/) __Version: 19 (latest)__: - https://cdn.componentator.com/spa.min@19.js `85 kB gzipped` - https://cdn.componentator.com/spa.min@19.css `22 kB gzippped` ```html ``` - __LTS:__ https://cdn.componentator.com/spa.min@19stable.js `83 kB gzipped` ::: Version: __18__ - https://cdn.componentator.com/spa.min@18.js - https://cdn.componentator.com/spa.min@18.css ```html ``` ::: ::: Version: __17__ - https://cdn.componentator.com/spa.min@17.js - https://cdn.componentator.com/spa.min@17.css ```html ``` ::: ::: Version: __16__ - https://cdn.componentator.com/spa.min@16.js - https://cdn.componentator.com/spa.min@16.css ```html ``` :::

items.body:
```html Type your name ``` < :far fa-lightbulb: __Good to know__:
Do you want to create your reusable UI components? Learn from more than __300 existing UI components__: https://componentator.com. ::: Usage in HTML Each component can be initialized in HTML directly and components can be added into various elements like `div`, `span`, `a`, etc.. __Declaration__: ```html ``` - `componentname` is required ([browse names](https://componentator.com)) - `path` is optional and it can contain `null` value - `config` is optional and it can contain `null` value - `default` value is optional, but it's evaluated as a raw object, e.g. `null` is `null` __Singleton component example__: ```html ``` __Example with data-binding__: ```html ``` - `path.to.model` is translated to `window.path.to.model` automatically - component watches changes in the model __Example with data-binding and configuration__: ```html ``` - jComponent follows HTML 5 standards __Real code (independent) samples__: ```html Getting Started Projects ``` __Example with Plugins__: - [Read more about Plugins](/components/40d03002xw50c/) ```html
Detail
Schemas
Content
 Amount
1Email verification
2Phone verification
 ``` ::: ::: Declaration With the jComponent library is very easy to create reusable UI components. Follow the example below. - [This example on JSFiddle](https://jsfiddle.net/petersirka/tebwo1rL/) __Declaration__: ```js COMPONENT('time', function(self) { var interval; self.readonly(); self.make = function() { interval = setInterval(function() { self.text(new Date().format('HH:mm:ss')); }, 1000); }; self.destroy = function() { clearInterval(interval); }; }); ``` __Usage__: ```html ``` ::: ::: Configuration Configuration of the components is a very important part and it's stored in
`` attribute. __Good to know:__ - `Number` is parsed as `Number`, e.g. `key:123` or `key:123.45` - `Boolean` is parsed as `Boolean`, e.g. `key:false` or `key:true` - `Environment` values are parsed automatically, e.g. `key:[key_in_env]` - if your value contains `:` colon the you can encode it via backslash `\:` - you don't need to encode absolute URL addresses, e.g. `key:https://www.google.sk` - __IMPORTANT__: entire configuration can be binded according to the path, example: `=path.to.variable` - __NEW__: dynamic config values `=key1:path.to.variable;=key2:path.to.variable` Each component needs to have implemented the delegate below: ```javascript // This delegate is executed for each key from configuration self.configure = function(key, value, init, prev) { // @key {String} // @value {String/Number/Boolean/Object} // @init {Boolean} Is initialization? // @prev {String/Number/Boolean/Object} A previous value switch (key) { case 'required': self.tclass('required', value); break; case 'icon': self.find('.fa').rclass2('fa-').aclass('fa fa-' + value); break; } }; ``` Processed component can be reconfigured via: - `self.reconfigure('key3:value3;key4:value')` or - `self.reconfigure({ key3: 'value3', key4: 'value4' })` - __Quick tip__: `RECONFIGURE('#mytextboxid', 'required:false')` Re-configuration doesn't cancel previous configuration, only extends it. #### Reserved keywords Please don't use the keywords below in your configuration. They are reserved and used for state management of the component. - `touched {Boolean}` means if the user has affected a value - `invalid {Boolean}` means if the value is not valid - `modified {Boolean}` means if the component changed a value #### Special configuration Special configuration is part of jComponent `+v16`. - `$id:string` component id - `$class:string` can toggle class when the component is ready - `$binding:1` enables real-time binding only - `$binding:2` enables binding after change only - `$delay:300` binding delay - `$init:path.to.method` executes a method if the component is initialized - `$setter:path.to.method` executes a method if the setter is modified - `$state:path.to.method` executes a method if the component changes the state - `$reconfigure:path.to.method` executes a method if the component is reconfigured - `$compile:false` disables a compilation for nested components - __NEW__ `$assign:path.to.property` assigns a current instance of the component according to the path (`+v18`) - `$url:/editor.html` downloads a declaration of the component __only one time__ before is component processed (`+v17`) __Example of url usage__: ```html Example of url usage ``` #### Responsive configuration `+v18` supports a responsive configuration. jComponent library sets the value according to the current display mode, and if the display mode is changed, the library reconfigures all components automatically. - form: `key:@displaymode=VALUE_1 @displaymode=VALUE_2` __Supported display modes and appearance__: - `xs` extra small display - `sm` small display - `md` medium display - `lg` large display - __NEW__ `dark` dark mode - __NEW__ `light` light mode __Example__: ```html ``` :far fa-warning: __IMPORTANT__: `dark` and `light` modes can't be mixed with display modes for the same configuration key. ::: ::: Data-Binding Data-Binding performs two way Data-Binding between the component and the model. - component creates a listener on the `path` and the component will react on its changes - delegate `component.setter` processes data-binding on the component side - these global methods perform a change in the model and notify all components: - `SET()` - `PUSH()` - `UPD()` - `INC()` - `EXTEND()` ```html ``` ::: ::: Special binding for nested components `+v16` supports special data-binding for nested jComponents. Path of nested component must start with `@` char. __For example__: ```html ``` - component `A` can set data to `B` component via `component.data('path', 'some data')` - nested component `B` is listening on the owner/parent component `A` ::: ::: Special binding between components and data-bind attribute `+v18` supports binding a value via `` command `set` (works with `VBINDARRAY` too). Also `.` dot in the component's path is very important, it allows to bind a value from `` attributel. __Example__: ```html or ``` ::: ::: Versioning `+v14.0.0` jComponent supports versioning of components. In other words: you can provide multiple same components with different versions. - [Browse CDN versions](https://github.com/totaljs/components/tree/master/0cdn) - jComponent downloads specific version automatically if it's missing ### Specifying a component version ```js // COMPONENT('name@VERSION', ...) COMPONENT('textbox', function(self, config) { self.make = function() { console.log('textbox'); }; }); COMPONENT('textbox@1', function(self, config) { self.make = function() { console.log('textbox v1'); }; }); COMPONENT('textbox@2', function(self, config) { self.make = function() { console.log('textbox v2'); }; }); ``` __Multiple versions in the one component__: ```js COMPONENT('textbox, textbox@1, textbox@2', function(self, config) { self.make = function() { console.log('3 versions of textbox'); }; }); ``` ### Usage in HTML ```html ``` ### Good to know jComponent library brings great new features for versioning. You can define same components with different functionality. ### Set a default version to all components This version will be applied to all components which don't have added specific version manually. ```js DEF.version = '1'; // {String} Sets the default version for all components // Default: empty ``` ### Set a default version to specific components This version will be applied to all components which don't have added specific version manually. ```js VERSION('textbox@1', 'dropdown@3', 'textarea@2'); ``` ::: ::: UI components We have prepared a lot of UI components - __more than 300__. - __Free UI components:__ [__www.componentator.com__](https://componentator.com) - [Download source-code](https://github.com/totaljs/components) - [Download pre-compiled HTML components](https://github.com/totaljs/components/0cdn/) - [jComponent uses __KeyCDN__](https://www.keycdn.com/?a=41841) ## Importing We have prepared __CDN with all components__. So you can import components which you really need. Components are always up-to-date. - [__GitHub repository__ with pre-compiled components](https://github.com/totaljs/components/tree/master/0cdn) - __CDN__: - __CDN__ contains files with lower-case file names - each file is plain text HTML file which contains styles, script and inline HTML ### Import via ` ``` ### Import via `IMPORT()` ```javascript IMPORT('https://cdn.componentator.com/j-textbox.html'); IMPORT('https://cdn.componentator.com/j-textarea.html'); IMPORT('https://cdn.componentator.com/j-dropdown.html'); // With a specific version IMPORT('https://cdn.componentator.com/j-textbox@1.html'); // Cached IMPORTCACHE('https://cdn.componentator.com/j-textbox.html', '5 minutes'); IMPORTCACHE('https://cdn.componentator.com/j-textarea.html', '5 minutes'); IMPORTCACHE('https://cdn.componentator.com/j-dropdown.html', '5 minutes'); ``` ### Fallback for non exist components jComponent __+v14__ supports a fallback for non-exist components. The fallback URL is specified in `DEF.fallback` variable (default value is targeted to __Componentator CDN__ provided on [__KeyCDN__](https://www.keycdn.com/?a=41841)). - [__Live example__ on jsFiddle](https://jsfiddle.net/petersirka/y4a2s06v/1/) ```javascript DEF.fallback = 'https://cdn.componentator.com/j-{0}.html'; // Default value // jComponent replaces {0} for a component name DEF.fallbackcache = '2 days'; // Cache fallback components for 2 days // Components will be cached in localStorage ``` If the compiler doesn't find some component then it tries to download it according to the `fallback` URL. If the `fallback` won't contain any URL then __import fallback__ will be disabled. --- All components are under __MIT license__. ::: ::: LAZY components Some of the components support lazy load, e.g., `datepicker`, `colorpicker`, etc.. Lazy load means, that the component is loaded when called directly by executing some method in the component. __Example__: ```html ``` __Handling__: ```js var opt = {}; ... ... // The method below initializes a LAZY component SETTER('datepicker/show', opt); ``` __Good to know__: - `!` at the beginning selector name, e.g. `SETTER('!datepicker/hide')` will execute the method `hide` only when the component is loaded. If the component isn't loaded, then the library skips the execution. :::

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
__DBMS__ is a simple Node.js ORM that is fully optimized for the Total.js framework and PostgreSQL database. The module offers excellent functionality.

__Example__:

```js
var builder = DBMS().find('tbl_product');
builder.fields('id,name,price,dtcreated');
builder.take(10);
builder.sort('dtcreated');
builder.callback(console.log);
```

__Async/Await__:

```js
var products = await DBMS().find('tbl_product').fields('id,name,price,dtcreated').promise();
console.log(products);
```

## Supported databases

- PostgreSQL
- MySQL/MariaDB
- ~MongoDB~ (partially)
- Total.js TextDB

## Installation

Module can be installed via NPM or just download source-code and copy it to `/node_modules/dbms` directory.

- first install DBMS module `$ npm install dbms`
- then install PostgreSQL module `$ npm install pg`
- then install MySQL module `$ npm install mysql2`

## Usage

Using of DBMS in Total.js applications is very easy, just follow steps below:

::: Connection string

We recommend to store connection string in `/config` file of Total.js application like this:

```html
database    : postgresql://user:password@localhost:5432/database?pooling=false
// database    : mysql://user:password@localhost:3306/database?pooling=false
```

__Additional arguments for PostgreSQL__:

- `pooling=Boolean` enables/disables pooling (default: `true`)
- `max=Number` max. connections (default: `4`)
- `min=Number` min. connections (default: `2`)
- `native=Boolean` enables native PG binding (default: `false`)

:::

::: Initialization

Just create a definition file called `/definitions/db.js` in your Total.js applications and copy the code below. Then you can use `DBMS()` method everywhere in your application.

```js
require('dbms').init(CONF.database, ERROR('DBMS'));
```

- `ERROR('DBMS')` is targeted for auto-handling of DB errors (it's part of Total.js framework)
:::

::: Query execution
If you have completed the steps above then you can use DBMS methods everywhere in server-side code.

```js
DBMS().find('tbl_user').take(10).callback(console.log);
```
:::

__Initialization method__:

```js
require('dbms').init([db_name], 'connection_string', [error_handling]);
// @db_name {String} database name, optional
// @connection_string {String} a connection string
// @error_handling {Function(err)} optional
```

__Example__:

```js
// You can provide multiple databases together:
require('dbms').init('postgresql://user:password@localhost:5432/database', ERROR('PostgreSQL'));
require('dbms').init('textdb', ERROR('TextDB'));
require('dbms').init('inmemory', 'inmemory', ERROR('InMemory'))
require('dbms').init('opendb://yourdomain.com?token=YOUR_TOKEN&ssl=1', ERROR('OpenDB'));

DBMS().insert('tbl_user', { id: UID(), name: 'Peter' }); // PostgreSQL
DBMS().insert('textdb/users', { id: UID(), name: 'Peter' }); // TextDB
DBMS().insert('inmemory/users', { id: UID(), name: 'Peter' }); // InMemory
```

- [Download Total.js PostgreSQL project](https://github.com/totaljs/emptyproject-postgresql)

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
__OpenSync__ is a lightweight synchronization HTTP server that can handle external requests according to the channels and send their data to all connected clients. The app contains many excellent features and a simple type of communication controlled from the command line. Moreover, the project is without any 3rd party dependencies with low hardware requirements. - __MIT license__ - [OpenSync on GitHub](https://github.com/totaljs/opensync) - Supports [Total.js Extensions](/extensions/) - Supports [Total.js Message Service](/tms/) - [__Support Total.js Platform__](https://www.totaljs.com/community/) < __Good to know__:
The primary task of OpenSync is to re-send incoming data to all connected clients via WebSocket or Server-Sent Events. The app will respond with HTTP status `200` and empty body. ## Installation - [Node.js +v14](https://nodejs.org) __Docker__: ```bash $ docker pull totalplatform/opensync $ docker run -p 8000:8000 -d totalplatform/opensync ``` __or__ [download the project from GitHub](https://github.com/totaljs/opensync): ```bash $ cd opensync $ npm install $ npm start ``` - :far fa-globe: Then visit setup: ## Communication __OpenSync__ server listens to all requests on the address `http://yourdomain.com/sync/{channel}/`. This endpoint supports all standard HTTP methods and supports files sent via `multipart/form-data`. __Send data via HTTP__: - send data via GET/POST/PUT/PATCH/DELETE method to the endpoint: `http://yourdomain.com/sync/{channel}/` __Send data via WebSocket__: ```js { "type": "notify", "channel": "YOUR_CHANNEL_NAME", "body": { /* your data custom data */ } } ``` ### WebSocket - Text communication (data serialized in JSON format) - URL address: `wss://opensync.yourserver.com/?token=YOUR_TOKEN` - or __NEW__: URL address with the app name `wss://opensync.yourserver.com/?token=YOUR_TOKEN&app=YOUR_APPNAME` - OpenSync socket will send `init` message: ```js { type: 'init', name: 'OpenSync instance name', version: 1, id: 'OpenSync' } ``` ### Server-Sent Events - Text communication (data serialized in JSON format) - URL address: `https://opensync.yourserver.com/?token=YOUR_TOKEN` __Request example__: ```request GET https://opensync.yourserver.com/?token=YOUR_TOKEN Content-Type: text/event-stream ``` OpenSync will send `init` message: ```js { type: 'init', name: 'OpenSync instance name', version: 1, id: 'OpenSync' } ``` ## Message OpenSync will send a message in the form below: ```js { id: String, // Internal ID channel: String, // Channel ip: String, // Host IP address method: String, // HTTP method (upper-case) headers: Object, // Key:value query: Object, // Key:value body: Object, // JSON or key:value, ua: String, // Parsed user-agent files: [Object Array] // Uploaded files { filename: String, extension: String, type: String, size: Number, url: String, width: Number, height: Number } } ``` < :far fa-warning: __Good to know:__
The OpenSync app will remove all uploaded files after `1 hour`.

__Extensible__ is a lightweight HTTP server app that can handle dynamic Total.js extensions. You can easily upload your various extensions to this application. Moreover, the project is without any 3rd party dependencies with low hardware requirements.

- __MIT license__
- [Extensible on GitHub](https://github.com/totaljs/extensible)
- Supports [Total.js Extensions](/extensions/)
- Supports [Total.js Message Service](/tms/)
- [__Support Total.js Platform__](https://www.totaljs.com/community/)

## Installation

- [Node.js +v14](https://nodejs.org)

__Docker__:

```bash
$ docker pull totalplatform/extensible
$ docker run -p 8000:8000 -d totalplatform/extensible
```

__or__ [download the project from GitHub](https://github.com/totaljs/extensible):

```bash
$ cd extensible
$ npm install
$ npm start
```

- :far fa-globe: Then visit setup: <http://127.0.0.1:8000>

## How to create extension?

- Read more in [`Extensions` section](/extensions/)

items.body:
__OpenAuth__ is a lightweight OAuth 2.0 integrator app that can obtain user profile from various services like Facebook, Google, Apple, etc.. Moreover, the project is without any 3rd party dependencies with low hardware requirements. - __MIT license__ - [OpenAuth on GitHub](https://github.com/totaljs/opensocial) - Supports [Total.js Extensions](/extensions/) - Supports [Total.js Message Service](/tms/) - [__Support Total.js Platform__](https://www.totaljs.com/community/) < __Good to know__:
The primary task of OpenAuth is to obtain user profile + `access_token` from external web service. ## Installation - [Node.js +v14](https://nodejs.org) __Docker__: ```bash $ docker pull totalplatform/openauth $ docker run -p 8000:8000 -d totalplatform/openauth ``` __or__ [download the project from GitHub](https://github.com/totaljs/openauth): ```bash $ cd openauth $ npm install $ npm start ``` - :far fa-globe: Then visit setup: ## Sign-in / Login OpenAuth is based on extensions that extend the app by adding new services and functionality. However, sign-in process is very easy, first you need to create a `POST` request to the OpenAuth app in the form: ```request POST https://openauth.yourserver.com/?token=YOUR_OPENAUTH_TOKEN Content-Type: application/json { "serviceid": "apple", "sessionid": "your_random_identifier", "url": "https://yourwebsite.com/auth/" } ``` Then the OpenAuth will respond with the URL address to the __OAuth authority__, and you need to redirect the user to this URL address. ```html https://appleid.apple.com/auth/authorize?redirec.... ``` If the user will be logged, then the OpenAuth will redirect the user to your `url` address defined in the first request in the form `https://yourwebsite.com/auth/?sessionid=your_random_identifier`. Now, you need to create a request to the `OpenAuth` app again due to obtaining a user profile. It's very easy, just make a request in the form: ```request GET https://openauth.yourserver.com/sessions/?token=YOUR_OPENAUTH_TOKEN&id=your_random_identifier ``` Or the below request will return all open sessions. ```request GET https://openauth.yourserver.com/sessions/?token=YOUR_OPENAUTH_TOKEN ``` < :far fa-trash-alt: Existing sessions will expire after __15 minutes__. ### Good to know If you don't use `url` parameter in the first request, then the user profile will be returned via WebSocket directly to all connected clients. ### User profile OpenAuth tries to create a unified user profile. However, data depends on the response, and each service sends different data so that some fields may be empty. ```js { serviceid: String, sessionid: String, id: String, nick: String, name: String, firstname: String, middlename: String, lastname: String, email: String, phone: String, gender: String, photo: URL, access_token: String, expire: Date, response: Object // a raw response from the OAuth authority } ``` ## Supported services - __Facebook (free)__ - Google (premium) - Apple (premium) - GitHub (premium) - LinkedIn (premium) - VKontakte (premium) - Yandex (premium) - Dropbox (premium) - Netatmo (only token, premium) < __Premium extensions:__
If you want to use our Premium extensions, contact us: or https://www.totaljs.com/support/

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
< __Good to know__:
[__Total.js Flow__](https://www.totaljs.com/flow/) is something else than __FlowStream__. FlowStream is an extension of the Total.js framework, which implements very similar functionality to Total.js Flow. It's something like a core of Total.js Flow, nothing more. __Flow Stream__ is the right tool for creating user-defined automation in Visual Programming Interface. __Flow Stream__ processes incoming data through the registered components and transforms them. - [`FLOWSTREAM()` method](/total4/407ff001jy51c/#63a3d001af51c) - [UI component called j-Flow](https://componentator.com/components/j-flow/) - [FlowStream app](https://github.com/totaljs/flowstream/) __Good to know__: - `Flow` means a created `FlowStream` instance - `FlowComponent` means a declaration of the component - `FlowInstance` is a created instance from the component declaration - `FlowMessage` is an object which is created from all `.send()` methods whithin FlowStream ::: Example ```js var flow = FLOWSTREAM(); // is the same as FLOWSTREAM('default'); flow.register('uppercase', function(instance) { instance.inputs = [{ id: 'input', name: 'Input' }]; instance.outputs = [{ id: 'output', name: 'Output' }]; instance.message = function(msg) { msg.data = msg.data.toUpperCase(); // sends transformed data to output "0" msg.send('output'); }; }); flow.register('reverse', function(instance) { instance.inputs = [{ id: 'input', name: 'Input' }]; instance.outputs = [{ id: 'output', name: 'Output' }]; instance.message = function(msg) { var arr = msg.data.split(''); arr.reverse(); msg.data = arr.join(''); // sends transformed data to output "0" msg.send('output'); }; }); flow.register('debug', function(instance) { instance.inputs = [{ id: 'input', name: 'Input' }]; instance.message = function(msg) { console.log(msg.data); // IMPORTANT: Destroys message msg.destroy(); }; }); flow.use(`{ "com1": { "component": "uppercase", "connections": { "output": [{ "id": "com2", "index": "input" }] } }, "com2": { "component": "reverse", "connections": { "output": [{ "id": "com3", "index": "input" }] } }, "com3": { "component": "debug" } }`, function() { flow.trigger('com1__0', 'Hello world!'); setTimeout(() => flow.destroy(), 2000); }); ``` :::

items.name: schema.define(name, type, [required], [error_message])
items.body:
The method defines a field for the current entity.

- [Schema data types](/total4/4083d001td51c/#data-types)

```js
schema.define(name, type, [required], [error_message]);
// @name {String} Name of property/field.
// @type {Object} Type of property.
// @required {Boolean/Function} Is required? +v2.9.0 supports "function(value, model)" for field validation. This function needs to return "Boolean" or "String" as error description.
// @error_message {String} a custom error message if the value isn't valid
```

### Basic types

- `uid`
- `string` or `string(length)`
- `boolean`
- `date`
- `number` (a default value is `0`)
- `number2` (a default value is `null`)
- `email`
- `url`
- `zip`
- `phone`
- `object`
- `uppercase` or `uppercase(length)`
- `lowercase`or `lowercase(length)`
- `capitalize2` or `capitalize2(length)` only first letter will be capitalize
- `capitalize` or `capitalize(length)` all first letters will be capitalize
- `name` or `name(length)` transforms value to a name (removes special characters and numbers)
- `json`
- `base64`
- `safestring` it contains a check for XSS and SQL Injections
- `color` hex color (supports transparency)
- `icon` Font-Awesome icon
- `guid` GUID
- __NEW__ `byte` or `tinyint` a number between 0 and 255
- __NEW__ `smallint` a number between -32767 and 32767
- `schema_name` links value with another schema
- `name:name, age:number, dtbirth:date` quick sub-object filtered value
- __array__: `[type]` or `[type(length)]` (for string values only)

__Example__:

```js
schema.define('name', 'name(30)');
schema.define('price', 'number');
schema.define('tags', '[string(30)]'); // Array type
schema.define('user', 'name:string, age:number');
schema.define('address', 'Address'); // linked with another schema Address
```

### Advanced types

__Enum type__:

```js
schema.define('gender', ['male', 'female']); // Enum with strings
schema.define('prop', [1, 2, 0.3, 4]); // Enum with numbers
```

__Key/Value__:

```js
schema.define('prop', { a: 'VALUE A', b: 'VALUE B', c: 'VALUE C' }); // KEY & VALUE
schema.define('prop', { a: [1, 2, 3, 4], b: { name: 'Total.js' } }); // KEY & VALUE (advanced)
```

__Functions as types__:

```js
schema.define('prop', UID);       // is same as 'UID'
schema.define('prop', String);    // is same as 'String'
schema.define('prop', Number);    // is same as 'Number'
schema.define('prop', Boolean);   // is same as 'Boolean'
schema.define('prop', Object);    // is same as 'Object'
schema.define('prop', Date);      // is same as 'Date'
```

### Example

```js
NEWSCHEMA('Users', function(schema) {

	schema.define('id', 'UID');
	schema.define('name', 'Capitalize(30)', true); // The framework trims long strings automatically
	schema.define('email', 'Email');
	schema.define('age', Number);

	// +v2.9.0
	// Supports field validation
	schema.define('age', Number, (value, model) => model.from18 && value > 18);
	schema.define('isterms', Boolean, value => value === true);

	// +v3.0.0
	// Sets a default value
	schema.define('id', 'UID')(() => UID());
	schema.define('age', Number)(20);
	schema.define('name', String)('Peter');
	schema.define('created', Date)(() => new Date());

});
```

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
__Total.js FlowStream App__ is a highly customizable and advanced tool similar to __Total.js Flow__. See our [blog post](https://blog.totaljs.com/posts/704043001ff61b/) to find out more about the differences. In this documentation you will find the details about [FlowStream App](https://github.com/totaljs/flowstream). To find out more about the core functionality of the __FlowStream alghorithm__ use the link to the documentation bellow.

- [Documentation: __FlowStream algorithm__](/total4/5aed1001bj51c/)
- [FlowStream WebSite](https://www.totaljs.com/flowstream/)

## Installation

- [Node.js v14 or higher](https://nodejs.org)

__Docker__:

```bash
$ docker pull totalplatform/flowstream
$ docker run -p 8000:8000 -d totalplatform/flowstream
```

__or__ [download the project from GitHub](https://github.com/totaljs/flowstream):

```bash
$ cd flowstream
$ npm install
$ npm start
```

## FlowStream App

FlowStream App uses [FlowStream algorithm](/total4/5aed1001bj51c/) and [FlowStream designer](https://github.com/totaljs/flowdesigner).

The [FlowStream algorithm](/total4/5aed1001bj51c/) itself is a part of the [Total.js Framework v4](https://github.com/totaljs/framework4) and requires some code in order to make it actualy do something. This is where the [FlowStream app](https://www.totaljs.com/flowstream/) comes in. It allows you to run one or more FlowStream instances each in its own [Node.js worker thread](https://nodejs.org/api/worker_threads.html). So it essentially acts as a manager. It also allows you to open an editor for any of the running instances of FlowStream and that's where the [FlowStream designer](https://github.com/totaljs/flowdesigner) comes in.
items.search: welcome totaljs flowstream ap flowstream algorithm instalation docker or flowstream ap

items.name: Welcome
items.body:
__Total.js framework__ is a server-side MVC framework written in pure JavaScript and fully optimized for Node.js runtime. Total.js apps are __pure JavaScript__ apps, so you don't need any external dependencies or specific tools in most cases.

## Install Node.js Platform

First of all, you need to install the Node.js Platform. __Node.js Platform__ is a runtime that can evaluate scripts written in JavaScript via Terminal or Command-Line. So each Total.js application starts with a start script (in most cases called `index.js`).

- [Install __Node.js platform__](https://nodejs.org/en/)

The installation installs Node.js runtime and __NPM__ (Node Package Manager www.npmjs.com), which allows you to install various dependencies like the Total.js framework. NPM will be part of your terminal or command-line; its alias is `npm`.

__Installing of Total.js framework__:

- `$ npm install total4` installs Total.js as a local module to the current directory
- `$ npm install -g total4` installs Total.js a global module to user directory with executable helper tool
	- then, you will be able to use `$ total4 --help` tool

## Download app template

- download e.g. [REST empty-project](https://github.com/totaljs/emptyproject-restservice)
- open terminal or command-line and write `cd emptyproject-restservice`
- perform `npm install` (only one-time)
- and run the app `node index.js`

In the terminal or command-line output, you will see internal information from the Total.js application like URL address, etc...

## How to develop?

We recommend trying our rapid Total.js Cloud Development. You can quickly develop various types of applications.

- [Cloud development](https://platform.totaljs.com?open=Cloud)

items.name: Parts
items.body:
Parts are very helpful if you want to render some group of components and you can choose different parts in the view where will be parts of components rendered.

__Declaration `/components/cms.html`__:

```html
A component content.

@{part header}
    HEADER
@{end}

@{part footer}
    FOOTER
@{end}

<script total>
	exports.group = 'cms';
</script>
```

__Usage in views__:

```html
<header>
	<!-- Here will be rendered all parts of components which contain part "header" -->
	@{part('header')}
</header>

<main>
	BLA BLA
</main>

<footer>
	<!-- Here will be rendered all parts of components which contain part "footer" -->
	@{part('footer')}
</footer>

<!-- To include all the components with a 'cms' group use the bellow command
@{components('cms')}
```

items.body:
__Total.js UI library__ contains everything that a front-end developer needs for web development. Also, developers can create hybrid mobile applications (PWA) with the UI library. #### JS library `spa.min.js` contains: - Core for creating SPA and reusable UI components - Client-side routing for controlling of HTML History API - Tangular template engine - Helpers for Tangular - Array helpers - Number helpers - String helpers - Date helpers - jQuery library #### CSS library `spa.min.css` contains: - Bootstrap v3 Grid System (supported classes `.row, col-xs-NUMBER, col-sm-NUMBER, col-md-NUMBER, col-lg-NUMBER`) + Tables - Font-Awesome Icons v5 Free - Predefined styles: - `b` font-weight `bold` - `block` display-block - `color` dynamic color variable - `m` margin-bottom `15px` - `np` padding `0` - `npt` padding-top `0` - `npb` padding-bottom `0` - `npl` padding-left `0` - `npr` padding-right `0` - `nmt` margin-top `0` - `nmb` margin-bottom `0` - `nml` margin-left `0` - `nmr` margin-right `0` - `mt5` margin-top `5px` - `mt10` margin-top `10px` - `mr5` margin-right `5px` - `mr10` margin-right `10px` - `fs11` font-size `11px` - `fs12` font-size `12px` - `table-small` a small table - `padding` padding `20px` - `link` a link class (can be used for `` too) - `help` a simple small info message, e.g. `
Field is required
` - `ui-dark` preddefined `` class with dark background and light foreground color - `red` --> `color: red` - `blue` --> `color: blue` - `green` --> `color: green` - `orange` --> `color: orange` - `silver` --> `color: silver` - `gray` --> `color: gray` - `noscrollbar` hides vertical scrollbars `+v17` - `hellip` crops the string with hellip `...` - `nogutters` removes padding in all `col-` classes __Predefined CSS variables__: - `var(--color)` contains `#4285F4` - `var(--radius)` contains `3px` - `+v19` supports `var(--margin)` contains `15px` - `+v19` supports `var(--gap)` contains `20px` - __NEW__: `+v19` supports `var(--rgb)` contains `66,133,244` (parsed hex `--color`) __`+v19` new grid system__: ```html
column 1
column 2
column 3
column 4
``` It makes a CSS grid system with `-NUMBER` defined columns. You can specify a column count per display type. The maximum column count is `12`. `+v18` added the classes below automatically when the document is ready: - __Browser detection:__ - `jc-chrome` - `jc-opera` - `jc-edge` - `jc-firefox` - `jc-safari` - `jc-ie` - `jc-electron` - `jc-samsungbrowser` - __OS detection:__ - `jc-mac` - `jc-linux` - `jc-windows` - `jc-webos` - `jc-ios` - `jc-android` - __Device detection:__ - `jc-desktop` - `jc-mobile` - `jc-table` - `jc-tv` - __Display__: - `jc-lg` large display - `jc-md` medium display - `jc-sm` small display - `jc-xs` extra small display - __Other:__ - `jc-nocookies` disabled `cookies` - `jc-nostorage` disabled `localStorage` - `jc-touch` device supports touches - `jc-standalone` standalone app
